items.content:
Associate Technical Project Manager

PRI is a close-knit team of smart, creative professionals. We are a well-respected interactive agency based out of New Jersey known for our deep strategic thinking. We create comprehensive web experiences that span across channels (web, mobile, and social). Innovation is at the core of our colleague relationships and client work – not just for the sake of innovation, but to elevate the end users’ experiences and exceed our clients’ unique goals.


We are looking for a Technical Project Manager to serve as a bridge between our clients and development teams. You will be responsible for gathering requirements, managing and prioritizing project tasks, leading client meetings, and ensuring project goals are achieved. This role is completely remote and operates within Eastern Time Zone business hours.


Role and Responsibilities:


  • Gathering requirements, including stakeholder or user interviews.
  • Thinking critically to analyze business problems and develop an approach that best suits our clients’ needs.
  • Creating and executing project plans, utilizing Agile methodologies to meet changing needs and requirements.
  • Identifying risks and resolving them proactively with consideration for short- and long-term project impact.
  • Managing day-to-day operational aspects of assigned projects and meeting client deadlines.
  • Carefully reviewing and contributing to team deliverables before sharing with the client.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


  • You are hyper-organized, detail-oriented, and able to take ownership of projects to ensure quality and client satisfaction.
  • You appreciate data-driven decision making and a well thought out plan.
  • You have worked on technical projects before and understand the Agile software development lifecycle.
  • You understand business processes/requirements and how they translate into technical requirements.
  • You are professional and comfortable working with senior executives.
  • You have strong communication skills.
  • You have experience working remotely with distributed teams.
  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science or related field.
  • 3+ years at a top consulting firm, agency, or other relevant experience.

items.title: Vice President, Growth Marketing
items.content:
Remote

Location: United States
Category: Marketing
Job Type: Full-Time

About WayBetter:

Our mission is to motivate people to live way better. Towards that end, we’re assembling the world’s largest online community of people committed to making positive changes.

WayBetter is reinventing motivation itself. We make a whole new category of games that help people stick to their commitments from eating better to exercising more to cooking healthy meals to starting a running habit. Our games–which include DietBet, StepBet, RunBet, and QuitBet–use an innovative mix of manageable goals, social support, and financial incentives to deliver efficacy.

Our approach is based on behavioral science and it works. To date, we’ve hosted 900,000 unique paying players who have collectively lost 13 million pounds and walked or run 100 million miles. And we’ve paid out over $80 million to winners of our games.

In our games and in our work we believe that fun is the secret to sustainable success. As such we care a lot about our culture and practice what we preach by making it enjoyable, social, and rewarding.

WayBetter is the rare company with a double bottom line: we succeed when our customers do. Our team gets inspired by reading about all the lives we’re changing in very real ways. We hope you get inspired too.

About this role:

As VP of Growth Marketing, you will be a key member of the WayBetter leadership team, responsible for continued development and execution of the company’s growth initiatives. You will drive strategy and optimization across all marketing channels, including retention, paid, referral, organic and affiliate. You will lead a talented team of five that includes retention marketers, visual designers, copywriters, and content marketers. You will report to the Chief Operating Officer.

  • Lead, develop and manage a team of five marketers.
  • Develop and execute a launch plan for a new WayBetter app.
  • Oversee performance efforts across awareness, acquisition and retention marketing campaigns, ensuring efficiency across all channels.
  • Craft and optimize user onboarding experiences that are appropriate for each marketing channel, with a particular emphasis on prospect email collection and conversion. Test, design, source, scale and iterate as needed.
  • Ensure that all collateral and touchpoints are aligned across the brand.
  • Test new user acquisition growth channels.
  • Collaborate closely with Product Managers to hit quarterly goals (OKRs).
  • Partner closely with Business Intelligence/Analytics and Tech to ensure best-in-class reporting across all touchpoints, from top-of-funnel to post-conversion.

Who You Are:

  • Expert B2C marketing knowledge, primarily app and web-based
  • Startup or small company experience
  • Overseeing performance marketing operations, preferably a blend across retention and paid
  • High level of comfort and fluency with marketing funnel analytics
  • A leader who is comfortable with ambiguity; willing and able to deliver a comprehensive point of view as related to future user acquisition efforts
  • Can effectively manage a team of marketers
  • Excellent communicator, both in writing and verbally
  • A collaborative style of work, specifically working closely with Product Managers to support their goals
  • Progressive career growth, including developing and managing high performing teams
Apply for job

items.title: Head of Design
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote

USA

Hello internet friend, we are Imgur’s find wonderful people team (or talent acquisition if you wanna get technical), and we’re on the lookout for an incredible Head of Design. Sound good? Good.

Imgur?

Let us introduce ourselves we are Imgur. The place where memes are born and selfies get downvoted into oblivion. We have a community of bajillions (this is a somewhat official estimate), who visit every day and leave with smiles on their faces. A community where anyone can post a picture of their dog’s butt and be internet-famous the very same day, the American Dream is alive and well folks. The magic of the internet.

Imgur’s mission is to lift the world’s spirits and we like to bring that mentality to our work every day. We see it as an honor and a privilege to work on a tech product that genuinely makes people happier.

Or in the much more succinct and professional sounding words of our communications team…

Imgur is the easiest way to discover and enjoy the internet’s most entertaining content. It’s where you’ll find the internet’s funniest, most informative and inspiring images, memes, GIFs, and visual stories. Powered by a passionate community of people from all around the world, we put smiles on the faces of over 250m people around the world each month.

You?

We’re looking for a talented Head of Design to be the voice of design across Imgur and to manage and mentor a world-class growing design team. You will help to define, lead and execute the design brand and UX strategy while working alongside our engineering, product and community teams. If you are passionate about design and inspiring teams to build better products, then this role may be for you.

The role:

  • Lead design strategy at Imgur, both pushing our design forward and maintaining brand cohesiveness for all products
  • Evolve Imgur’s design practice and processes
  • Collaborate with the cofounders to evolve the Imgur brand and identity
  • Manage and mentor a small product design team where you’ll promote a highly collaborative, fun, and creative team culture
  • Roll up your sleeves and be able to execute designs from whiteboard to prototypes, working with product managers and engineers – this is a hands-on role
  • Collaborate with product managers to review user data and conduct user research and translate it into effective design solutions
  • Be a strategic design partner to our leadership team

What you bring to the table:

  • 10+ years of UI/UX experience, including experience as a design team lead
  • A leader who prefers to lead by doing, you can’t resist the urge to practice your craft by rolling up your sleeves and working alongside your team to unlock creativity.
  • Proven ability to work cross-platform (iOS, Android, desktop web, mobile web) and across all levels of fidelity (whiteboard to wireframes, mockups, and prototypes)
  • A respected designer and product thinker that has mastered their craft
  • A mentor who is energized by growing others’ careers and knows how to motivate a team
  • Experience with navigating ambiguity and moving quickly and iteratively.
  • Values business awareness, understands the technologies used and pursues research and data insights.
  • Stellar written and verbal communication skills and excellent attention to detail
  • Skills in a wide range of design and prototyping tools (we use Figma)
  • You are excited about what we are building at Imgur

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary, fully covered medical/dental/vision
  • 401k matching
  • Flexible PTO per year
  • Wellness stipend
  • Commuter/parking benefits
  • Opportunity to work on the world’s largest image-sharing community!
  • Dogs in the office
  • Work from home Wednesdays!
  • Work the way that works for you! Work in the office or remote.
Apply for job

items.title: Human Resources Director
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote

Remote
Full-time

Company Description

Astreya is the leading IT solutions provider to deliver technology-enabled services and fuel digital transformation to some of the most exciting companies on the planet. We are at the cusp of a new way of working with our delivery model that helps our clients be positively productive by matching exceptional people to on-site teams delivering world-class IT service. With engineers in over 30 countries and 70 cities around the world, we are a global company working with the world’s most recognizable and innovative organizations.

Job Description

As a champion of Astreya’s culture and values, you will contribute both strategically and hands-on as we continue to scale our business. This is a critical, highly-visible role where you will contribute to efforts that build HR functional excellence (people, process/programs & systems) and drive continuous process improvements to deliver efficient, effective HR core services to leaders, managers and employees.

As an integral part of the Astreya Talent and Culture Leadership Team, you will need to understand every aspect of the business and be a thought leader on people and organizational topics.
The Human Resources Director role will report to the VP, Global Talent, and Culture.

Your responsibilities:

  • Build and cultivate strong partnerships with senior leaders to offer thought leadership on organizational and people-related strategy and execution to ensure a high-performing, engaged workforce
  • Advise, guide and coach leaders at all levels within Astreya to navigate the complexities of managing teams, managing career development, developing a high performance culture, providing conflict resolution strategies, and providing candid feedback about talent moves, gaps, promotions, and growth opportunities
  • Collaborate with all HR functions (Employee Relations, Talent Acquisition, Compensation, People Ops and Learning) in the design and implementation of People programs
  • Manage and develop team of HR Business Partners globally, HR Operations
  • Analyze and present relevant metrics and insights to the business to drive the focus and execution of strategy
  • Adhere to the highest degree of professional standards and strict confidentiality on matters that require discretion

Required qualifications:

  • Extensive experience influencing business leaders individually and collectively. You have the courage to propose solutions others are reluctant to address, act in the face of resistance and advocate for the best interests of the organization
  • A strategic mindset, but can also focus on tactical and operational issues. You are comfortable rolling up your sleeves to get things done and the next moment being part of deeply complex strategic discussions
  • Experience helping global organizations scale, and cultivating relationships globally
  • A belief in a “People-first” approach to build teams and drive effective performance across the organization
  • Comfort working in a fast-paced technology environment where change and ambiguity are common
  • A passion for innovative HR solutions and process improvement
  • A learning mindset and willingness to try new approaches, incorporating different viewpoints and ideas, while still sharing and drawing upon your areas of expertise
  • Experience in bringing others along a journey through communication, demonstration and modeling of behavior, and driving accountability
  • Ability to identify and track metrics of success (results and outcome orientation)
  • Unquestioned integrity with assertiveness, presence, and confidence. Excellent influencing skills at all levels in the organization and competence in making timely, effective, principles-based decisions
  • Strong business and financial acumen, including strong problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and business analysis skills
  • Exceptional communication and relationship building skills. Highly collaborative style and desire to work as a team with a results-driven approach
  • Bachelor’s degree with 10+ years of HR / HRBP experience in roles of increasing complexity and scope. You are a subject matter expert, with demonstrated experience in coaching and development, organizational design and overall talent management, benefits and compensation
  • Minimum of 5+ years leading HR in an HRBP model
  • HR certification such as PHR, SPHR or GPHR
  • Experience with Workday HCM strongly preferred

What can Astreya offer you?

  • Working with some of the biggest firms in the world as part of the Astreya delivery network
  • Employment in the fast-growing IT space providing you with brilliant career options for years to come
  • Introduction to the new ways of working and awesome technologies
  • Career paths to help you establish where you want to go
  • A company-wide mentoring program to advise you along the way
  • Online training courses through CBT-nuggets to upskill you
  • Performance management system to provide you with meaningful, actionable feedback
  • Dedicated management to provide you with a point of leadership and care
  • Internal promotion focus. We love to build people from within.
  • Numerous on-the-job perks
  • Peer Recognition
  • Market competitive rates and benefits
Apply for job

items.title: Head of Data Engineering and Analytics
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Remote

Location: United States – Remote

About us

TeamSnap is committed to helping take the work out of play for over 20 million enthusiastic customers in 195 countries. We seek to delight our customers each and every day with our award-winning communication and management services for recreational and competitive sports teams, tournaments and organizations. Our remote first team operates on our core values of trust, ownership, passion, fun, commitment, and respect. We work hard so our customers can play.

TeamSnap is seeking a seasoned data executive with strong technical and team management experience to build out a world-class data function. With more than 11 years of legacy infrastructure, millions of daily users, and the complexity of running consumer, SAS, payment, and advertising businesses, this role is perfect for a data leader who’s ready to roll up their sleeves and solve challenging problems. This role will span the entire lifecycle of analytics, from data engineering to business insightsIn addition to solving complex data problems, this leader will inherit two strong analysts and have the opportunity to build a high-performing data team. At TeamSnap, we pride ourselves on our amazing culture. If you’re passionate about building great teams, too, we want to hear from you.This role will report to the President and will support all lines of business at the company.

What you’ll be doing

We may be an 11 year old company, but you’ll be helping us rebuild out data capability end-to-end. That includes overhauling our data infrastructure (in partnership with data engineers), defining best practices for data management, building a presentation layer (e.g., Tableau, Looker), creating a strong analytical framework for managing the business, and building a kick-butt analytics team to support you in all this.

Location

Almost anywhere! We are headquartered in Boulder, Colorado, but this job is remote (unless you happen to live near Boulder, in which case you’re welcome to come to the office). TeamSnap is a mostly-distributed company, so you must be very comfortable working with people who aren’t in the same physical location as you or each other. While we love all parts of the world, we can only hire US-based citizens at this time.

Some things that are important

  • Deep understanding of the modern ELT pipeline using the following (or equivalent) tools. This includes Fivetran, dbt, BigQuery.
  • We are primarily a Google Cloud shop, but we are open to the right tools for the job.
  • Expert Level SQL Knowledge
  • Experience working with Looker and/or Tableau
  • Strong opinions on how, what, and where data should be collected.
  • Thought leadership around user privacy for internal and external uses
  • Great cross-functional leadership; experienced partnering with other leaders to understand and address their needs
  • Strong communication skills; you can articulate a vision and rally others behind it
  • A deep understanding of data analysis, statistics, financial reporting, forecasting, and test design
  • Experience building and managing project plans
  • Track record of building and leading high-performing data teams

Other things that would be nice to have

  • Experience in B2B SAS, direct-to-consumer, and advertising businesses (yes, TeamSnap has them all!)
  • Payments experience
  • A strong network of data professionals who you could draw from to build your team
  • Be a parent, coach, or participant in a recreational sport.
  • That’s who we serve and we want you to love it, too!
  • Be a TeamSnap user (sign up for a free trial to see what we’re about)

Benefits and Perks

  • Competitive salary
  • Equity
  • Medical/dental/vision for you and your family
  • Education reimbursement up to $1,500/yr
  • Wellness stipend of $50/mo
  • 401k
  • Free TeamSnap service for your family and friends
  • Free TeamSnap swag
  • Flexible PTO and vacation policy

Why TeamSnap?

If you’re excited to work on a product that people use and love this is your place (seriously, our customers stop us on the streets, planes and trains to tell us how much they love our product!). While we’re relatively small, we’re not a fly-by-night startup. If you’re looking for an opportunity to show off the very best of your skills, in an environment of trust, respect and flexibility, this might very well be the best job you’ll ever have. We’re passionate about helping our customers spend less time organizing and more time playing.

Apply for job

items.title: Head of Marketing
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=24, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About Kugali
Kugali is a company that showcases the best African stories using art comics and animation, stories that respect the history of Africa, embrace the present and imagine a future. At Kugalie we're not only passionate about addressing the lack of diversity in the comics and animation industry, but also creating opportunities for more creatives of colour to tell their stories.


 


Kugali has grown from the launch of the first Pan-African comic book anthology launched via a Kickstarter, https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/kugalimedia/the-kugali-anthology, to being the largest publisher of African inspired comics in the world, with our first major animation project also underway. We’re interested in bringing in new people to help us build on our recent success and through the next phase of growth, scale into a global leader in story telling.


About you


The ideal candidate will serve as the lead marketing executive. You will manage all marketing efforts including planning, research, advertising, communications and public relations in line with our objectives. The role would be part-time 3 days/week and we're open to working remotely.


 


Responsibilities



  • Measure marketing program effectiveness and KPIs to drive continuous improvement in strategy and output

  • Organize department meetings, conduct personnel reviews, and attend managerial meetings

  • Participate in organization-wide strategy planning and expand our thinking around the role of marketing in achieving growth

  • Oversee marketing expenses and resources including relationships with external vendors and advertising and media firms

  • Support the launch and growth of a digital platform


 


Qualifications



  • Experience within the publishing, entertainment and tech sectors is a bonus

  • 5+ years in marketing roles covering B2B and B2C

  • Experience launching and running international marketing initiatives Americas, EMEA

  • Experience working with and managing remote teams

items.title: Legal Reporter
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=1, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote
  • Req #: JREQ133337
  • Job Function: News & Editorial

Job Description

Reuters is seeking an experienced legal reporter to hit the ground running and cover a wide range of legal news, from the business of law to litigation in a number of practice areas. The ideal candidate will write about high-profile court filings and rulings on a daily basis and will also be expected to proactively identify broader trends and bellwether cases as they develop. This journalist must be able to report deeply and write quickly and with insight for a targeted readership of legal professionals. Familiarity with legal research tools is essential as is a curiosity to delve into the world of white shoe and plaintiffs’ lawyers, lobbyists and special interest groups. A minimum of two years of experience covering legal news is a must.

The position will offer an ambitious reporter the opportunity to deepen expertise in a rich subject area. It will primarily involve writing for Practitioner Insights, a news platform for customers of Thomson Reuters’ flagship legal platform Westlaw. This is a great opportunity for anyone interested in legal news and in being part of a high-profile enterprise that is of strategic importance to the company.

This role is remote-based, can be located across the United States.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Locations
Chicago-Illinois-United States of America;San Francisco-California-United States of America;Remote-United States of America

Apply for job

items.title: Technical Program Manager at Roon Labs LLC

hiringOrganization.name: Roon Labs LLC – No office location

items.content:
Technical Program Manager

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Product Manager, System Administrator
Industry: Internet of Things, Music, Software Development
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Roon Labs LLC – No office location

Technologies

sysadmin

Job description

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Work closely with the tech project managers, business units of the company and external partners.
  • Liaise between the tech department and other arms of the business for successful launch coordination.
  • Gather and organize technical and operational requirements.
  • Plan and manage software releases.
  • Coordinate our partner support efforts across multiple time zones.
  • Make sure our pre-flight checklists are all checked off before launching a new project.
  • Making sure all the teams have the most up-to-date information on the projects

To apply for the Technical Program Manager position, please click on the link below!

https://forms.zohopublic.com/roonlabsllc/form/JobApplicationForm/formperma/wM7FV6rQRyXYtoIk94AU69fVllRWoMMufuVDyfZ3S3Q?jobid=557180000000608165

Easy apply

About Roon Labs LLC

The Roon team has a common passion for music, sound, and user experience. We are proud to deliver high quality, well-loved software (and some hardware) to music lovers and audiophiles all over the world. Our subscribers are more than customers; they’re fans who share our passion for music and participate vigorously in the community that surrounds our product, which has become the gold standard for music players in the “audiophile” world.

Roon Labs is a self-funded, profitable small business founded in 2015 which currently has 20 employees. All of its principals are hands-on and work for the company full time. We’re growing at a quick but manageable pace – 80-100% year-on-year subscriber growth. 

When we founded the company, we set out to delight the most demanding music enthusiasts and audiophiles, not to acquire a billion users. That vision stands today… we don’t have outside investors because we don’t want our product vision to conflict with our business goals. Roon is a premium-priced offering designed for a specialist audience, so we don’t need massive scale and we avoid the risk of being forced into an exit by business pressures.

Roon Labs is notionally headquartered in New York, but we have no offices. Instead, our team is distributed across three continents, and everyone works remotely. Many members of our team travel extensively around the world. We have a long history of working this way, and we love the flexibility and lifestyle that it allows.

Benefits

  • Health/Dental/Vision (80/20)
  • 401k with match
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Flexible Time Off
  • Full Time Remote

items.title: Head of Growth
items.content:
Remote

at MURAL (View all jobs)

Remote

MURAL is on a mission to inspire and connect imagination workers globally.

MURAL is a digital workspace for visual collaboration. Our platform and services enable innovative teams to think and collaborate visually to solve important problems. People benefit from MURAL’s speed and ease of use in creating diagrams, which are popular in design thinking and agile methodologies, as well as tools to facilitate more impactful meetings and workshops.

Global enterprises including IBM, USAA, E-Trade, Intuit, SAP, Atlassian, Autodesk and GitHub have embraced visual collaboration to align their teams, plan in real-time, speed up decision making, reduce travel costs and accelerate a culture of innovation. MURAL’s certified enterprise-class cloud-based infrastructure connects 40 percent of Fortune 100 global enterprises, drawing the support of leading investors from Radian Capital, Gradient Ventures, Endeavor Catalyst and others.

MURAL is headquartered in San Francisco and employs over 100 people working remotely across six time zones around the world, including office hubs in Buenos Aires and Europe. We recently raised $23M in a Series A round of financing, so we are ready to take MURAL to the next level.

YOUR MISSION

As MURAL’s Head of Growth you will:

  • Own the end to end process of customer acquisition, activation conversion to payer in the self-serve offering.
  • Manage and build a group of product teams focused on Onboarding, Activation, and monetization in the self-serve offering.
  • Own the monetization and pricing strategy in the self-serve offering.
  • Co-own with Marketing the process to identify and hand off sales qualified leads to the Sales organization.
  • Work closely with the Head of Marketing, Head of Product, and Head of Data to define and execute successful initiatives that drive membership growth via retention, engagement, and virality.
  • Define the Product Growth strategy, and own MURAL’s Growth models.
  • Understand the competitive landscape, to ensure we’re on top of the latest patterns that work in other products.
  • Mentor and guide product managers, helping to develop their product management skills.
  • Collaborate with our teams in Engineering, Design, Product Management, Customer Support, Customer Success, Sales, BizOps, DevOps, and QA
  • Communicate regularly with our customers and partners.

YOUR PROFILE

The top candidate will have the following skills:

  • 8+ years of product management experience in a B2B SaaS or B2C product.
  • Experience building and leading teams of product managers focused on growth and monetization.
  • Proven track record running A/B tests, understanding customer needs, launching successful features, communicating results, and collaborating with cross functional teams.
  • Experience working in a high-growth company with fast-paced decision making processes.
  • Experience working remotely with a global team
  • Experience running experiments and building growth models.
  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills
  • An eye for design
  • A good sense of humor

Ideally you have…

  • You have experience in Design Thinking and design methods expertise
  • You have worked with remote collaboration software.

WHAT WE OFFER

In addition to being part of our quest to help people empower their imagination, we offer:

  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Flexible working hours
  • Ability to work remotely
  • Flexible time off
  • A phenomenal learning environment for you to develop

OUR VALUES

We bring people to our team that care about our mission to inspire and connect creative people globally, and who feel aligned with our values:

  • Make Others Successful
  • Adapt to Thrive
  • Show Up With a Smile
  • Generate Wows
  • Think Global
  • Play to Win and Have Fun

Practicing equality through imagination work.

MURAL is committed to creating diverse and inclusive workspaces where people can make a positive impact on the world and share their vision of how they achieve it. We are dedicated to working alongside multiple communities to help build this dream and bring it to life.

Apply for job

items.title: Director of Cloud Operations
items.content:
Remote

at ScienceLogic

Reston, VA or Remote

What we’re looking for

The Director of Cloud Operations is a newly created and hands on role overseeing a team of SaaS Engineers to deploy, manage, scale and automate a global footprint of the ScienceLogic SL1 SaaS platform, running in a hosted and public cloud environment.

Our Enterprise Systems IT team delivers exceptional SaaS IT management solutions that have a dramatic positive impact on our customer business operations. You will develop long-standing relationships with the technical experts at these customer organizations and assist them in planning extensions to their ScienceLogic products in-line with their strategic business growth.

The ideal candidate will possess superior leadership experience, excellent communications skills, broad technical abilities and service provider operations management experience. Our company values creativity and believes in accelerating individual professional development rewarding team members for individual and team accomplishments.

What you’ll be doing

  • Lead and grow a team of engineers and operators, motivated to deliver the leading AIOps platform to The World.
  • Drive a clear strategy for scaling product operations in the Public Cloud.
  • Be the go-to subject matter expert for our Cloud Operations group to scale and optimize our new SaaS delivery model.
  • Deploy new SaaS hosted customers and provide customer triage in partnership with the Technical Support and Professional Services team
  • Meet regularly with our SaaS customers on operational effectiveness and to ensure SLA’s and expectations are met
  • Collaborate with Product Management and Engineering teams to clearly define and execute our SaaS strategy
  • Maintain strong communication with the Sales team to articulate our cloud offerings model
  • Collaborate with IT team to manage/scale our infrastructure footprint to meet our global customer growth demands
  • Relentlessly drive automation across ScienceLogic SaaS operations, and its interfaces with other ScienceLogic business groups.
  • Be a key leader helping define the roadmap and evolution of the ScienceLogic cloud offering and go-to-market strategy in collaboration with the product organization.
  • Partner with the Finance team to maintain and optimize the operational cost models for the ScienceLogic SaaS offering.
  • Manage the establishment of operational success measures and weekly executive management reporting.
  • Manage customer escalations to resolution when they occur in close collaboration with our Technical Support team, offering oversight and customer management as appropriate.
  • Ensure contractual SLA responsibilities are met and achieve high levels of uptime and customer satisfaction.
  • Define and build a global 24×7 NOC team.

Qualities you possess

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related degree is required.
  • Must have experience running operations for software products in the Public Cloud.
  • 7+ years of IT operations, NOC/SOC or SaaS management from a service provider or equivalent organization.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and professionally both verbal and written.
  • Experience interacting with external customers and providing regular delivery updates.
  • Familiar with modern automation concepts, tools and techniques (e.g. CI/CD, Ansible)
  • Broad IT knowledge and experience of networking, storage, compute and security.
  • Knowledge with monitoring protocols and techniques.
  • Must have experience in Linux/Unix operating environment.
  • Experience with public cloud providers such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud.
  • Securing SaaS products or working with Security Teams is a plus.
  • Must be detail oriented and able to deal with multiple project complexities at once.

About ScienceLogic

ScienceLogic is a leader in IT Operations Management, providing modern IT operations with actionable insights to resolve and predict problems faster in a digital, ephemeral world. Its solution sees everything across cloud and distributed architectures, contextualizes data through relationship mapping, and acts on this insight through integration and automation.

Apply for job

items.title: Director of Fund Development
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=6, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote

Full-time, remote position. $75,000-$80,000

THE OPPORTUNITY:

  • We seek an ambitious, entrepreneurial development leader to partner closely with our CEO, staff, and Board on short-term and long-term fund development.
  • The new Director of Fund Development will be responsible for securing financial resources from all donor segments, especially individual donors, to support our strategic plan.
  • Our ideal candidate brings creativity and drive to increase our fundraising capabilities.

ABOUT TECHNOVATION:

  • Technovation (technovation.org), a global tech education nonprofit, empowers girls and families to become leaders, creators, and problem-solvers.
  • With support from corporate partners such as Adobe, Google, Salesforce, Cisco, and NVIDIA, along with generous individuals, our flagship programs have engaged and transformed the lives of over 130,000 underserved youth and reached more than 28,000 industry mentors, educators, and parents in 100+ countries.
  • Our two signature programs bring to life our innovative, real-life learning model:
  • Technovation Families unites families, schools, and mentors to learn, play, and create with artificial intelligence.
  • Through hands-on projects, children (ages 8-16) and adults learn and use AI tools to address real-world problems in their communities.
  • Among others, our program has been featured in The Wall Street Journal and Entrepreneur.
  • Technovation Girls equips young women (ages 10-18) to become tech entrepreneurs and leaders.
  • With the support of program mentors, girls work in teams to code mobile apps that address complex, real-world problems.
  • We are featured in the award-winning documentary, CodeGirl, as well as publications including Fast Company, Forbes, and more.
  • This is a challenging, but fulfilling time for us at Technovation. Online education, parent-child co-learning, real-world problem solving, virtual mentoring, engaging girls and women, AI education – are all-powerful levers that we need to continue making progress. But, it is also a time of uncertainty and challenge.
  • We are fueled knowing that we can help children and communities around the world prepare for future shocks through education.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Creating annual fundraising and long-term goals in collaboration with senior staff
  • Providing the tactics and strategy to achieve fundraising goals with an emphasis on metrics and outcomes that strengthen acquisition, retention, and value
  • Write persuasive grant proposals and reports
  • Lead, grow, and retain a high-performing development team of staff, contractors, and volunteers to learn and apply fundraising best practices in order to achieve fundraising goals
  • Partner with communications teammates to create key messages and calls to action in materials, and execute all aspects of fundraising campaigns, from content strategy to campaign analytics
  • Developing and implementing a robust prospect acquisition strategy to reach potential supporters with likely affinity
  • Enhancing and maintaining our donor database (we use Streak). Work with other members of the team on improving acknowledgment processes and stewardship activities
  • Creating a prospect pipeline to consistently review the next steps required to secure funding, and detailed activities for Development, leadership, and Board members
  • Improving outreach to existing donors and prospective donors
  • Engaging Technovation leadership and board members in development activities
  • Promote a culture of continuous improvement that values learning

IDEAL CANDIDATE:

Our ideal candidate has:

  • Has a 5-7+ year track record of successfully fundraising at organizations with $3M+ revenue
  • Strongly resonates with our mission
  • Is ready to be hands-on, agile, and lead fundraising in a challenging COVID-19 environment. We typically write 3-5 pieces a week (concept notes, thought leadership pieces, proposals, reports, and most of them are slightly improved each time).
  • Has demonstrated success in identifying, cultivating, and soliciting annual gifts of over $500K from donors/funders
  • Has excellent organizational skills, e.g., planning and managing deadlines, working with CRM tools, assets, and people
  • Has a data-driven approach with demonstrated ability to share metrics and analytics
  • Is entrepreneurial with creative ability to conceive of and lead new ways to attract donors
  • Has excellent communication skills, both written and oral; ability to influence and engage a wide range of donors to build long-term relationships through presentations and events.
  • Has experience constructing, articulating, and implementing multi-year strategic development plans

WE OFFER:

Meaningful work. You’ll contribute directly to growing a movement, empowering girls and families to learn and use cutting-edge technologies to solve real-world problems impacting them in 100+ countries.
Autonomy. We don’t micromanage. We trust you to communicate clearly and discuss decisions with any people affected. In collaboration and negotiation with colleagues, you will be responsible for fundraising decision making.
Generous benefits and compensation. We offer 20 paid vacation days plus all federal holidays. We pay 100% of your healthcare premiums including vision and dental. Retirement plan options available after 1-year with employer matching after 2-year vesting period. Target compensation is $75,000-$80,000 a year commensurate with experience and market rates.
Workplace input. We are open to adopting new workflows, new software, or other improvements that you think would increase our success, if you are able to champion and gain agreement for recommendations from colleagues.
Flexible work environment. We have core hours, but no one is looking over your shoulder. Go to appointments when you need to, as long as you’re getting your work done in good quality and on time.

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity among its applicant pool as well as within our staff, Board, and partners. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply.

items.content:
Remote | Freelance
  • Cambridge, Massachusetts, United States
  • Solutions Team
  • Full-time

About Us:

Dimagi was born from the belief that there’s a better way to provide services to those in need. Our mission is to create digital products that support global development efforts and help accelerate the end of extreme poverty. CommCare, our mobile data collection platform, is designed to improve data collection and the quality of frontline services in low-resource settings around the world. We work across various sectors with organizations of all sizes providing mobile solutions that put end-users first. Working with partners that include the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, USAID, CARE International, and the World Bank, Dimagi has successfully implemented CommCare and supported 2,000 projects across 80 countries. Dimagi is a certified Benefit Corporation and leading social enterprise, working since 2002 towards our commitment to making an impact.

About the position:

Dimagi’s technology is being utilized for the COVID-19 response, and we are seeking someone who wants to use their technical background and project management knowhow to get things done.

Dimagi is looking for a Technical Project Manager to join our Solutions team. This position will be based out of our office in Cambridge, MA, but is also open to remote employment within the US. This role is a 12-month fixed-term position with the option for converting to a permanent status pending re-evaluation of requirements at the end of the contract.

In this role, you will take on accountability for the optimal design and development of mobile applications built on our flagship platform CommCare. This position will ensure the appropriate management of all business requirements, coordinating expectations across multiple stakeholders, and implementing all technical deliverables as per the specifications in a timely fashion.

You will be working in an agile environment, alongside a dynamic, multi-skilled team of developers, engineers, public health and development specialists.

Responsibilities:

  • Technical design and development of creative mobile technology solutions together with your project team, which includes:
    • Project scoping to combine technical and non-technical workflows to build a sustainable solution that works for users in low-resource settings.,
    • Responsible for managing the app building process by overseeing a team of resources
    • Manage project quality throughout the software development lifecycle
  • Create process and workflow mapping, diagrams, use cases, and other documents in support of projects.
  • Develop, maintain, and complete project documentation, including project plans, risk log, issues log, post-project reviews, etc.
  • Liaison between our engineers and our end users.
  • Provide project management guidance, training and mentoring to improve the effectiveness of the app building process through best practice
  • Work together with the Project Management Office to continuously improve the Project Management methodology from a technical standpoint

Minimum Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience in a technical position, producing technical designs for software solutions.
  • Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or relevant technical diploma or degree
  • Demonstrated expertise in collecting and managing requirements from different stakeholders and delivering against those.
  • Must be technically savvy and enjoy the design process to build applications that meet business goals and objectives.
  • Experience working in and coordinating with dynamic teams.
  • Self-motivated results-oriented team player.
  • Demonstrated reliability to predict time expectancy on job completion, and the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Be able to manage company and developer expectations through honest and timely updates.
  • Analytics and process-driven thinker.
  • Excellent organization skills.
  • Interest in making a social impact.
  • Eligible to work in the United States

Bonus skills:

  • Agile experience
  • Leadership experience in the adoption of best practices
  • Previous experience working within project management for software developers
  • Product management or software development experience (Python, Django, Javascript/jQuery, HTML5/CSS, Knockout, CouchDB, Postgres)
  • Experience in delivering enterprise software implementations
  • Experience with systems integration and/or databases
  • Data analysis experience
  • Experience with system and scenario flow diagrams, functional user assessments and testing, architecture and content structure and functional specifications

Benefits Provided:

We aim to make a difference, not just as a company, but as an employer as well. The benefits we offer are geared towards having a strong impact on our staff’s well being. A few of our key benefits are outlined below:

  • 100% employer-sponsored medical insurance paired with a generous Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) fund
  • Access to voluntary dental and vision insurance plans
  • A 401K plan with up to a 4% employer match
  • 30 days paid time off inclusive of holidays
  • Unlimited sick time, excellent parental leave policy, and a strong focus on work-life balance
  • Access to a flex-time policy that allows employees to work based on a flexible work schedule
  • Access to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) through Magellan Healthcare
  • 10 personal initiative days
  • Occasional opportunities to travel internationally

items.title: Tokyo Academics: Operations Manager
items.content:
Operations Manager

About the role 
 
You will be wearing many hats and hold a large range of small and large responsibilities. You will hold a key role with the management team, our students/parents, and our tutors. You will work daily with the CEO/CFO/Founder, COO, and Academic Director and will be in charge of the day-to-day and the development of new initiatives across several functions: operations, recruiting,  sales/marketing, and business development. 
 
This position is best suited for a self-driven individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment. This is an opportunity to really buy into the vision of a young and growing company and become a part of the core team in the long run. 
 
 
What you will work on 
  • Developing and executing operational and customer success processes
  • Be the operational head of one of our educational divisions, online vocabulary lessons (managing a team of 5-8 teachers)  
  • Supporting our students/parents on daily basis with the help of 3 community managers, a team of virtual assistants, and the management team 
  • Meeting with potential students and parents to explain and sell our services 
  • Collaborating with the management team to improve our current service offerings as well as launch new ones
  • Collaborating with our developer on improving our current platform as well as launching new features
  • Training your team to reach higher operational and sales performance
 
Our ideal candidate 
  • You have 3+ years of experience in a past operational, HR, or customer success role
  • You have prior experience hiring and managing a team, preferably in a remote environment
  • Your have prior experience setting up new processes, documentation, and KPIs
  • You have experience in marketing or have a strong interest in learning more about the industry 
  • You are a people person and an excellent communicator with both internal and external parties
  • You thrive in a fast paced, rigorous environment 
  • You are results oriented 
  • You are a native speaker of English
  • You have strong written communication skills 
  • Experience working in the field of education preferred but not required 
  • Ability to speak/read/write in Japanese is a plus 
 
Benefits 
  • Full-time remote job (with the possibility of travel to Japan a few times per year)
  • Join a growing bootstrapped company with a lot of potential for growth
  • Bonuses based on company growth 
  • Autonomy to implement ideas and have a significant impact
  • 20 days of paid time off per year

You will work on a range of greenfield projects that will expose you to the world of fintech and open banking. You will have experience in an agile environment, ideally one that is part of a small, cutting edge tech company. You will facilitate scrums whilst also producing Epics, Features, Stories and Wireframes.

If you are someone who wants to work in a highly agile, vibrant, tech-driven environment, where passion and enthusiasm for seeing the business succeed is absolutely paramount, then this role is for you.

Skills Required

  • Experience running scrums and coaching developers.

The successful candidate will receive:

items.title: Special Assistant to the Deputy Director of Programs
items.content:
Remote
  • FLEXIBLE
  • EXECUTIVE TEAM
  • FULL-TIME

Founded in 1979, the National Immigration Law Center (NILC) is the leading advocacy organization in the U.S. exclusively dedicated to defending and advancing the rights and opportunities of low-income immigrants and their loved ones. NILC’s mission is grounded in the belief that everyone living in the U.S. — regardless of race, gender/gender identity, immigration status, or economic status — should have equal access to justice, resources, and educational and economic opportunities that enable them to achieve their full human potential. NILC is committed to advancing its mission — which intersects race, immigration status, and class — through a racial, economic, and gender justice and equity orientation.

Headquartered in Los Angeles with an office in Washington, DC, NILC seeks to achieve just laws and policies that address systemic inequities, create narrative and culture change for an inclusive and equitable society, and build a healthier and more powerful movement.

NILC is seeking a Special Assistant to provide high-level executive level project management and administrative support to the Deputy Director of Programs.

The role will be based out of the headquarters in Los Angeles, the office in Washington, D.C., or remotely.

Responsibilities

  • Provide management assistance to the Deputy Director of Programs, including project planning and execution, preparation for meetings, agenda setting and coordination, follow-up activities, and overseeing calendar, travel schedule and management of expense reports.
  • Works directly with Program teams. Identifies communication needs of diverse stakeholders, including the Development and Operations teams and the Executive Office. Establishes protocols for communicating programmatic work that enhances flow of information across all levels of the organization, vertical and horizontal.
  • Oversees execution for projects (evaluation, work planning, goals setting, budget development and management) led by or under purview of the Deputy Director of Programs. Provides appropriate coordination on projects and tasks, including planning, troubleshooting, progress reporting, researching and interacting with staff and consultants.
  • Supports the Deputy Director of Programs in leading NILC’s program evaluation and impact initiative. Provides professional support by conducting research, synthesizing and analyzing data on programs, extrapolating lessons learned and essential points critical to management.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Experience

  • Proven track report of successfully supporting an executive or organizational leader.
  • Bachelor’s degree and minimum of four years’ experience with a positive growth trajectory, or equivalent work experience.
  • Familiarity with the immigration movement and related topics is a plus.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Ability to work independently, prioritize and multi-task with minimum supervision in a fast paced and demanding environment. Able to successfully work under ambiguity and rapid change.
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage up and across. Detail oriented and flexible with excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Intermediate or Advanced experience with MS Suite and shared workspace platforms. Able to synthesize complex information and comfortably present data.
  • Able to maintain a high degree of confidentiality and discretion, as a member of a dynamic team.
  • Superior relationship-building skills.
  • Able to effectively manage difficult or sensitive situations. Courteous and professional manner and ability to maintain a calm and professional manner under pressure and with constantly shifting priorities.
  • Multicultural sensitivity, with a commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion.

The expected salary range for this position is $70,000 to $90,000 annualized, depending on experience.

NILC is an equal opportunity employer; people of color and individuals from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply. NILC does not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, citizenship status, ethnic background, religion, political orientation, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or any other protected class. We consider all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative.

Apply for job

Project Manager

SBG, a service disabled veteran owned small business specializing in engineering, information technology, cyber-security, and training, is looking for a results-oriented Project Manager. The ideal candidate would be an experienced individual who is hard-working, with the ability to excel in a fast-paced government contractor environment and is someone who has a positive energetic attitude. This is a remote position.

OVERVIEW

Support the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Veterans Benefits Management System (VBMS) program as a Project Manager. The Project Manager must have experience managing Information Technology related projects. Must be well versed in life cycle and project management methodologies. Must have experience in tracking costs, schedule and performance progress. Must be able to identify and mitigate risks.

items.title: Vice President of Design
items.content:
Remote

in Atlanta, GA; New York, NY; Remote

We’re Ushering a New Era of Data Participation. Interested?

We’re shaping the way companies manage data by helping customers connect the right data, insights, and algorithms for all Data Citizens. When everyone across the organization is enabled with data, true transformation can take place. We are building a team of exceptional people to help us deliver on that promise. If you are interested in a career at the leading edge of technology, we look forward to hearing from you.

How you’ll make an impact at Collibra:

Reporting into our Chief Product Officer, the VP, Design and will be responsible for leading our design strategy and our UX and UI team within the Product organization. Our ideal VP, Design is a collaborative, data-driven, creative, and resourceful leader who brings key experiences to the role as we create a unified, best in class, experience across all Collibra products.

A day in the life of a VP of Design at Collibra:

You’ll be reporting directly to the Chief Product Officer, and will be responsible for a wide range of tasks, including:

  • Researching, Analyzing and Determining the user experience for all personas’ workflows across Collibra’s Platform and Products.
  • Partnering closely with the Engineering and Product leaders and teams to create and align a product strategy that supports our users’ needs, and ensures that research, UI, UX, concepting, prototyping, and testing are integrated in every step of the product and development roadmaps.
  • Applying your deep understanding of user research to ensure that what gets built solves real user problems in a way that is simplistic, intuitive, consistent and seamless for all experience levels.
  • Overseeing and guiding rapid, iterative conceptual designs across Collibra’s platform, products, and marketplace.
  • Conducting regular design reviews, elevating designs with every visit.
  • Recruiting, building, leading, growing, and retaining a world-class team of fantastic UX, UI, and research designers and leaders.
  • Orchestrating and delivering bar-none product experiences within enterprise software at scale.
  • Leading by example and participating in all stages of the product design and development lifecycle, including generative research, concepting and definition, prototyping, UI design and testing. Your sketches, wireframes, mockups and prototypes will set the direction, bar, and tone for the next generation of design at Collibra.
  • Creating a clear vision on how to make Collibra a Category leader in SaaS software for Design, UX, and design culture

You Have:

  • 10+ years in UI/UX and Design leadership, ideally with a blend of experience in complex, cloud-native software products and consumer products
  • Experience attracting, leading, and inspiring highly talented, research and data-driven productive design organizations. Bonus points if you’ve built this with geographically distributed teams.
  • Extensive experience in interface design, research, and new product development in a high-growth, product driven company.
  • A track record of distilling complex, business objectives into design-driven product solutions.
  • You’re an advocate for the user’s perspective across all development phases, using their perspective to guide effective communication with cross-functional stakeholders and executives.
  • Passion and experience working with engineering, product and marketing
  • Establishment and measurement of customer facing metrics such as competitive analysis, product satisfaction, NPS, usability efficiency and ease of use
  • Hands on experience with variety of user research techniques including user testing, personas, user tasks and scenarios, internal and external user interviews
  • BA/BS in User Centric Design, Interactive Design, Product Design, Cognitive Psychology, Computer Science, or related discipline and experience; MBA preferred

We Offer:

  • A friendly, rapidly growing environment where your input will be valued and growth is fostered
  • Ongoing opportunities to collaborate with fellow Collibrians globally
  • Flexible hours = quality > quantity
  • Unlimited Vacation
  • A monthly allowance for your mobile
  • A state-of-the-art laptop for work
  • And of course, competitive benefits, compensation and equity

At Collibra, we’re focused on building a world-class company and culture, and that starts with the people we hire. We take pride in being an equal opportunity employer, and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

Apply for job

items.title: Project Manager II
items.content:
Remote | Freelance
  • Job ID: BH120429
  • Category: Project Manager
  • Industry: Biotechnology
  • Type: Temp/Contract
  • Location: REMOTE

Key responsibilities:

  • Lead project execution after deal closure.
  • Direct, lead and motivate multi-disciplinary project teams and hold team members accountable to deliver results within an agreed project governance structure to ensure customer satisfaction throughout the life of the program.
  • Shared customer relationship management with Account Managers.
  • Program Manager uses in depth understanding of multiple functions and strong relationships with these functions during the execution.
  • Act as single point of contact for customer with regards to operational questions and ensure each project milestone is delivered in line with the agreed objectives.
  • Act as the customer advocate and champion in the LPB organization.
  • Manage project scope, timelines and budget and program profitability together with core project team.
  • Raise and prepare scope changes and communicate them to a customer in close collaboration with Account Manager.
  • In collaboration with Account Management / Commercial Development, create mid-long term program strategies.
  • Define, organize and be responsible for all customer communication (using an open communication model), agreeing milestones and conducting “lessons learned” with the customer, as well as executing decommissioning at the end of contractual activities.
  • Program Manager ensures the right and effective internal and external governance are in place and are effective. Also ensures very clear alignment of internal stakeholders.

Key requirements:

  • Leadership – ability to manage group of people to act towards achieving a common goal; ability to drive execution through efficient communication, creating a trusting environment and taking personal accountability for decision and actions.
  • Driving Results – set ambitious and realistic plan and priorities, implement and monitor appropriate KPIs, to track progress, able to prioritize activities overcoming challenges while maintain high quality standard.
  • Agility – challenge status quo to improve processes, open to new ideas, able to learn from others and from personal experiences to propose and drive changes; use to navigate in ambiguity keeping focus on business requirements.
  • Effective Communication – ability to create clear sense of common purpose and direction through effective communication of goal, strategy and issue/challenges and adapting to the targeted audience.
  • Customer Focus – ability to quickly solve problems/conflict as and when they arise with a strong analytical mind-set. Actively drive and create solutions.
  • Business Awareness – translate strategy into actionable objectives and plans. Understand the key drivers affecting profitability, recognize business opportunities, identify improvements to meet the challenges within a given project/portfolio.
  • Influence – ability to work in a matrix management environment and gain the cooperation of others over whom they have no direct authority or control; create inspirational climate, demonstrate positive and constructive mindset.
  • 3-5 Years Experience

items.title: Operations Manager (Relocation to Casa Grande, AZ required) - New York, NY
items.content: Now hiring an Operations Manager for our Dedicated division at our Casa Grande, AZ office. Please note that this position is located in Casa Grande, AZ, this is not a remote position. This is a permanent, full-time opportunity.Transportation experience is a prerequisite for this position. The Operations Manager has a strong customer facing competent for a major account. Relocation assistance is available Why join us: S tability: The transportation industry is crucial to the U.S. economy, making C.R. England a stable career choice. As a 100 year-old leader in the transportation industry, we have grown 100% in the last decade. We will continue growing as we approach our second century. Employee Value: 2015 recipient of the Achievers Award for Most Engaged Workplaces in the U.S. Benefits: World class compensation and benefits packages, continuous training and development, and a team-oriented culture. Work life balance: At C.R. England we value family both in our individual homes and our company family; our culture embraces this philosophy and fosters an environment to support both. Schedule: Monday-Friday 1200-2200 and as needed on the weekends Summary: Position is at the very center of a fast-paced strategic environment. The Operations Managers is required to hire and develop people and plan ahead of rapidly changing situations while creating and maintaining a productive culture throughout the division/account. Person must be organized, proactive, and engaged with his or her peers and subordinates. Position Responsibilities: Position will manage a variety of departments and be responsible for multiple day-to-day aspects of the Division’s operations. Additionally, the Position troubleshoots areas of operational concern, evaluates and if necessary creates better processes in the interest of operational efficiency. Manage direct and indirect reports to including hiring, training, development, payroll, performance management and termination. Working with multiple individuals, departments, and divisions at once. Fleet production, ensuring all assets and drivers have sufficient miles to reach revenue goals Manage 50 drivers and direct fleet/account management day-to-day operations. May manage drivers through Fleet Managers or Logistics Coordinators. Dispatch drivers to ensure on-time delivery and advising on weather conditions. Coordinate with drivers to swap loads as necessary Track drivers, loads, and receivers Deal with multiple customers and their different special requirements at once Working with Load Planners, Driver Managers, Account Managers, Maintenance and Service Advisors and others within the company. Negotiate situations to meet expectations of customers, company and drivers. Identify logistical problems and implement solutions. Plan future workload Conflict resolution Handle urgent situations in a professional manner. Schedule/ re-schedule appointments with customers Multi-task as necessary This job is demanding and requires one to be patient, proactive, and professional. Essential job requirements may include, but not be limited to: Recognize areas of operational concern, develop processes, and coach employees to better suit the needs of CR England and the division. Must be a self-starter with time management skills requiring minimum supervision. Be willing and capable of taking on and working through the duties of his or her subordinates when needed. Must be a hands-on working manager who can motivate others. In a Dedicated environment, may have more interaction with customer or even be located on customer’s site. Must be able to communicate professionally and work to solve customer concerns while balancing business needs and resources. Keep company leadership informed of project priorities and any issues that may require their attention. Work with other department leaders to establish goals, align priorities and define departmental processes. Treat each individual with care, dignity, fairness, respect and recognition. Work productively and collaboratively with direct supervisor and peers. Display and encourage teamwork and willingness to be a problem solver. Practice and observe safety rules and regulations and encourage others to do so at all times. Always conduct yourself in a manner that reflects a positive, professional image. Must maintain a professional appearance in accordance with dress code policies. Adhere to all policies and procedures as set forth by the company and ensure that all employees are knowledgeable of and adhere to all standards set for by the company. Responsibilities Job qualifications may include, but not be limited to: Ability to work with office equipment, utilizing computers for majority of tasks and must be familiar with Microsoft Office suite of programs. AS400 / TMW system knowledge preferred Excellent organizational skills required. Accuracy and attention to detail. Energetic, enthusiastic self-starter with excellent organizational, communication, leadership and interpersonal skills Ability to organize and prioritize work, meet deadlines, work with minimal supervision, exercise judgment and adapt directions from one assignment to anothe Ability to maintain professionalism when communicating with team and management. Very dependable and take ownership of work processes Adaptable in a fast and changing environment. Assertive and competitive to meet customer’s needs and assistance company’s growth. Physical Requirements: Capable of hearing, with our without correction, sufficiently to perceive normal speaking levels and receive detailed information through oral communication in order to facilitate meetings and work with internal customers and stakeholders by telephone and in person. Position may involve kneeling, stooping, bending, pushing, lifting, carrying and moving objects that can weigh up to 25 pounds. Capable of working extended hours, to include weekends, holidays and various shifts (to include evening and night shifts) as necessary. Capable of sitting at a desk for extended periods of time and working with computer equipment. Capable of speaking, writing, and reading English well and possessing a good command of the language so that various types of communications may be conducted in English with people of various levels of education and capabilities. Capable of visual acuity, with or without correction, sufficient to prepare and analyze data and figures, view a computer terminal, and read extensively. Job Requirements: Education and Experience: 4 year degree preferred or commensurate transportation experience in conjunction with schooling. Advanced degree helpful. High school diploma required. Experience managing a fleet or similar transportation industry group. 5 years’ experience working in a logistics environment. Working Environment and Conditions: Must have the ability to work on more than one assignment at a time with frequent interruptions, changes and/or delays. Must be able to remain focused and work effectively, efficiently, and cheerfully under such circumstances. Must be able to handle incoming requests for assistance via phone and in person while working on other tasks. Must remain professional in light of challenging situations that may occur in the location. Some travel may be required, particularly on Dedicated accounts. CB

items.title: Manager of Job Research
items.content:
Remote
  • Full-time employee, flexible schedule, telecommute
  • Locations: CA, CO, CT, FL, IL, KY, MA, MD, ME, MN, NC, OR, PA, TN, TX, VA

Who We Are

Our mission is to improve the future of work by helping people find flexible jobs that make their lives better. We are committed to doing this internally and externally with integrity, intelligence, balance, communication, and care.

In the past 13 years, FlexJobs has established itself as the leader in the professional flexible job market to help job seekers connect with employers that offer these highly desired arrangements, as well as to help employers reach these candidates. We do this in a way that makes the job search experience easier, safer, and faster for job seekers, by utilizing both technology and human intelligence to provide a friendly, effective, and valuable service.

In terms of work flexibility, we also walk the talk! This is a remote job, as our entire team works remotely from locations all across the United States. Not only that, but having a great company culture is really important to us, and we’ve even been named one of Outside magazine’s Best Places to Work (2019) and Best Company Culture by Entrepreneur magazine (2018, 2017, and 2015). To learn more about our current team, you can explore our Team & Culture page.

Responsibilities of the Job: The Opportunity

The people on the jobs team include researchers, data entry specialists, and job specialists that each play a specific role in finding those “needles in the haystacks” that give our job seekers hope in a variety of different circumstances. The Manager of Job Research role is a new position that will be important to the continued success, health, and growth of the team. A big part of the job will be building and nurturing relationships, establishing clear and effective communication, helping to make sure processes are optimized, and tracking results.

This position will report directly to and support the senior director of job research. Specific duties that you will assist the senior director with include, but are not limited to: managing employee performance; monitoring the work of and relationships with freelancers; tracking and reporting of metrics; managing job feeds; hiring and onboarding of new hires; and other team projects.

Your Experience and Skills

  • 5-7 years experience in a remote leadership role that includes a team of employees and freelancers
  • Leadership approach that encourages collaboration and proactive communication, and the ability to be comfortable with making a decision when needed
  • Highly focused and super detail-oriented
  • Outstanding active listening skills and the ability to problem solve quickly and effectively
  • Solid research skills and a healthy dose of skepticism

Traits Required of All Team Members, You Included

  • A sense of pride in your work
  • A streak of perfectionism when it comes to details
  • Being highly organized, responsible, and ethical
  • Being proactive when it comes to asking questions, brainstorming, and working with colleagues
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • An appreciation and enthusiasm for the ability to work remotely

Other Requirements

  • Interest in a long-term position with a company that you’re proud to be a part of
  • A fully functioning home office, including high-speed internet access, a fast computer, and phone access
  • A work environment that is quiet and one in which you can really focus without distractions

How to Apply

If this job description makes you feel as if it was written perfectly for you, then please apply! What we’ll need:

  • An intro email/cover letter telling us why you want to work for FlexJobs (vs. another company)
  • What makes you a great fit for this position
  • What hourly rate or salary you would be comfortable with
  • Complete this Pairin assessment
  • A current resume in .doc, .docx, .pdf, .markdown, or .txt

Applications can be sent through FlexJobs or by email to jobs@flexjobs.com.

If you are selected to move forward, you may be required to do a background check.

FlexJobs is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate and support diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive work environment for all employees. As a part of this commitment, we have pledged to be an Open to All business.

FlexJobs is also a veteran- and military spouse-friendly employer. Our positions are perfectly structured for qualified candidates who meet this criterion and we have a workplace culture that supports their work and life.

Apply for job
