items.content:
Job Description



An a exciting opportunity to join Verado - an instant valuation and reselling startup - as VP of Growth. You'll play a key role in expanding their current performance marketing strategy while owning the growth marketing P&L.


ROLE OVERVIEW – VP GROWTH



  • Developing growth strategies in partnership with the executive team

  • Channel management - strategy and execution. Including GTM strategies for expansion and new channels.

  • Grow the company's top-line metrics, including revenue, customers, AOV, and customer LTV/CAC. Optimize CAC via efficient paid and unpaid acquisition channels .

  • Strategist and tactician. You need to be able to see the 30k foot view as well as jump into Google Analytics / Google Data Studio to build reports and lead from the front with data.

  • Play the role of player-coach. Lead your team from the weeds and inspire those around you.

  • Manage growth marketing P&L


YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE



  • Experience of scaling performance marketing for a fast growth business

  • Able to transition from strategic level vision to day-to-day operations

  • Proven leader with a background in building world class teams

  • Experience working with creatives to build targeted campaigns that people love and tell the brand story



  • Hyper quantitative and analytical; can tell stories with numbers and translate data into actionable insights and campaign optimization strategies

  • Google Analytics and Google Data Studio knowledge


HOW TO APPLY


Apply via WorkinStartups and answer our screening questionnaire: https://verado.typeform.com/to/kvAwAV


KEYWORDS


Growth, Marketing, Digital, Performance Marketing, Paid Media, Acquisition, SEO, SEM, Paid Search, Search, Social, Paid Social, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Programmatic, Display


Benefits:



  • Work from home opportunities

  • Flexible working hours


Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, Permanent

items.title: TestGorilla: HEAD OF MARKETING
items.content:
HEAD OF MARKETING

ABOUT TESTGORILLA
We make hiring the best people easy and unbiased, offering screening tests at an affordable price. Using TestGorilla, our customers save valuable time, make hiring decisions objectively, and avoid expensive mis-hires. 
 
Our tests are developed by deep subject matter experts (so called ´testpreneurs´). They get rewarded when their tests are used, and we help them make their tests better. This way we can offer the highest quality and widest range of tests in the market. 
 
We just finished a €1mln seed round and have ambitious plans for the coming years.

See www.testgorilla.com for more information.

ABOUT THE ROLE
As the Head of Marketing, your goal is to turbo-charge TestGorilla’s lead generation and conversion. You develop the marketing strategy, own all online and offline channels, and gradually build your team.

YOU
  • Share our passion for helping companies hire the best faster, easier, and bias-free 
  • Have at least 5 years of B2B SaaS marketing experience in a start-up environment 
  • Are passionate about using and working with data 
  • Have deep knowledge of B2B content marketing and SEO and have run successful content/editorial teams before 
  • Have a good understanding of PPC 
  • Possess a creative mindset 
  • Have a strong drive for results 
  • Can manage multiple projects at once 
  • Experience with HR tools or assessments is a plus 

OUR OFFER
  • The opportunity to work in a VC backed, promising HR tech startup 
  • As an early employee, you will have a huge role shaping what TestGorilla becomes 
  • The co-founders are your coach 
  • Your hours are flexible, and so is your vacation 
  • You can work wherever you want – we work remotely 
  • Salary: €50k base plus up to €10k bonus 

INTERESTED? PLEASE APPLY NOW BY TAKING THIS 1-HOUR ASSESSMENT

(You can also copy and paste this link into your browser: https://app.testgorilla.com/testtaker/publicinvitation/191055bd-fa4c-4ee6-8aa8-809091eea247)

items.title: Skup: Operations Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Operations Manager

Hey I’m Devin Zander ! I’m the co-founder and CEO of Skup, a remote-first Shopify app company that gives you everything you need to quickly start, grow and scale your e-commerce business. 

Our team of 17 people (based all over the world), work to develop unique tools and training that can transform our customer’s Shopify stores into multi million-dollar businesses. It’s pretty amazing to hear our customer results (and the thing that drives us the most).

I’m writing this unusually personal post from the first person because I’m in need of help (and I’m hoping you can be the right person to solve this problem ) . 

As a marketing and creative-first CEO, I’ve been struggling over the past few years to scale the company as fast as we’ve grown. Quite honestly, we have amazing team members, but we’ve never had an Operations person to make the entire machine run smoothly. I’ve tried, but it’s just not my best skill set. 

Now that we’ve really found our stride, I’m hoping to find the perfect fit for our company and to bring on someone who is excited about transforming Skup into the best version of itself. 

As a company, we’ve been built upon certain values within our team. We aim to grow a
family that is always:

  • Honest and Insightful
  • Engaging and Well-informed
  • Solution Experts
  • Proactive and Consistent

From a high-level, here are my current expectations of the role (but, who knows… this may change dependent on our needs):

  • Meet the team (we use Slack) - set up 1:1’s, review meetings, and get to know everyone. The team aspect will be the most important part of the job!
  • Review our current organizational systems and audit what we have
  • Create new operational systems for the company to build upon (operational, engineering, HR, customer success, and finance)
  • Creating team OKR’s to work towards as a team (each department)
  • Add documentation and materials into Notion (our company Wiki)
  • Meetings with department heads for on-going projects (you’ll be meeting with me, our CTO, and any other leads who are involved)
  • Bi-Weekly meeting with myself to go over Business Development ideas and project scopes (we can set up a time that works best for you)
  • Day to day focus on management processes, implementing new ideas, and working with team members to solve problems 
  • Hiring process updates and being the lead to hire, onboarding, and manage new team members

Honestly, it’ll be a role that has many responsibilities, but the general goal will simply be to help our team run more efficiently. 

Since we’ll be working together on such a close basis, I wanted to hear more about what YOU think it’ll take to succeed in this role. 

If you can respond with an email to Connect@skup.net with subject line “Systems for SKUP” and outline:

1) What do you think are the most important qualities you need to thrive in a team like this?

2) What do you think is critical for a CEO - Operations relationship to effectively communicate and execute on a day to day basis?

3) What is it about Operations that you love so much? 

4) Not required, but always is helpful: Shoot a short video explaining more about yourself and what’s getting you excited about SKUP. 

This is a fully remote, full-time position and we’ll be happy to invest in you, as well!

As a US employee you will earn:

  • Strong competitive salary (based on experience)
  • Potential revenue share based on performance
  • Incentivized bonuses based on OKR Progress
  • PPO Insurance (Health, Dental, Vision & Life) (We Pay 75%)
  • $1,000/Year in travel credits (Airbnb, or the airline of your choice)
  • $360/Year in “Pet funds” for your furry friends
  • $720/Year towards your gym membership
  • $240/Year towards your music subscription (Spotify, Pandora)
  • $180/Year towards learning another language (Babbel, Duolingo)

You’ll also earn benefits after 2 months:

  • 20 Vacation Days Per Year
  • Unlimited Book/Audiobook fund
  • Mentorship program reimbursement

We’re hoping you are a fit and excited to have you possibly join the SKUP Family - a team of intelligent, driven and friendly individuals with one goal in mind: to better the lives of others in the e-commerce space.

items.title: Head Of Developer Adoption
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=8, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Arweave

Head Of Developer Adoption

Head of Developer Adoption ON-SITE OR REMOTE – FULL TIME Overview Arweave is a permanent information storage network, built on a new type of blockchain called a blockweave. We are working to solve the problem of the ‘memory hole’, as formulated by George Orwell in Nineteen Eighty-Four, by building the first data storage medium that truly never forgets. Arweave works by rewarding network participants for contributing hard disk space to the network, in a similar fashion to proof of work in Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. What you’ll do Being Head of Developer Adoption at Arweave will require you to manage our team of developer advocates, as they grow and strengthen the Arweave developer community. Together with this team, you will:  * Devise, execute, evaluate and refine creative developer acquisition strategies. * Build and refine developer reward programmes for incentivising adoption of the Arweave network, focussing on tangible, clear outcomes. * Manage relationship life cycles with individual community members that apply for our grant and investment programmes, from sourcing to completion. About Yourself You are a strong communicator, work well in distributed teams and have proven technical aptitudes. Crucially, you have played a pivotal role in gaining the adoption of a developer-focused protocol/product at least once before.  About Us By providing permanent, low-cost, and truly censorship-resistant data storage for everyone, we strive to democratise the information space. To achieve this, our team has built and now supports an online, open source, blockchain-based network providing decentralised data storage distributed worldwide.  * We’re an English-language team of very skilled and highly motivated entrepreneurs and hackers with diverse academic and professional backgrounds. * In spring 2018, we graduated from the Techstars Berlin accelerator programme and have access to a worldwide network of expert advisors and investors. * We count with the support of notable investors like Andreessen Horowitz, Union Square Ventures, Multicoin Capital and Coinbase Ventures. You can read recent coverage about Arweave here and here. Arweave is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from everybody.

items.title: Aha!: Director of Strategic Success
items.content:
Director of Strategic Success

Do you want to revolutionize the way the world's leading technology companies build products and innovate? What about helping to drive strategic new services and go-to-market initiatives for one of the most respected SaaS companies in the world? Have you dreamed of finally being able to pursue bold new ideas with an exceptionally high-performing team?


We are looking for a goal-fixated individual who understands that new market opportunity abounds when you think deeply and see the world differently. If this is you, we want to hear from you!


As a Director of Strategic Success at Aha!, you will have an excellent opportunity to join a self-funded and profitable company that is growing fast. Aha! was founded by a proven team of experts. More than 300,000 users worldwide trust our roadmap software to build products customers love.


We are looking for someone who:

  • Has at least 7 years of top-tier management consulting or top SaaS strategic experience
  • Managed major new strategic initiatives from idea to market success
  • Developed and executed multiple new product, channel expansion, and go-to-market efforts
  • Brings deep thought and structure to everything they work on
  • Agrees that "good is the enemy of great"
  • Could never choose which one is more important – numbers or words
  • Humbly led cross-functional teams to greatness

We are committed to being great, and we want someone who:

  • Recognizes that their success is tied to the knowledge and collaboration of others
  • Understands that effort is what truly differentiates smart people and quality organizations
  • Can work at a fast-paced company where the culture is defined by its responsiveness
  • Has a "must get it done" attitude and radiates team spirit
  • Is seeking a career-defining opportunity with a proven, results-oriented team
  • Wants to report directly to the CEO

We are building a distributed team, and you can work from anywhere in the United States for this role. We offer generous salary, equity, benefits, and a profit-sharing program.

items.title: Billing Manager
items.content:
Remote

Location: United States National

Transforming the future of healthcare isn’t something we take lightly. It takes teams of the best and the brightest, working together to make an impact. As one of the largest healthcare technology companies in the U.S., we are a catalyst to accelerate the journey toward improved lives and healthier communities. Here at Change Healthcare, we’re using our influence to drive positive changes across the industry, and we want motivated and passionate people like you to help us continue to bring new and innovative ideas to life. If you’re ready to embrace your passion and do what you love with a company that’s committed to supporting your future, then you belong at Change Healthcare.

Pursue purpose. Champion innovation. Earn trust. Be agile. Include all.

Empower Your Future. Make a Difference.

This position will manage the Billing Process for clients who have contracted with the company for Medicaid billing services. Primarily, the position will manage an organization of production staff, which reports through Team Leaders, to ensure billing inventory is managed to the process activity metrics and financial goals as set by the company. Secondarily, this position will be responsible for managing the client relationship with regard to billing performance and will ensure that contacts made by his/her unit with client partners is accomplished in a way that facilitates the overall goals of the unit.

Location: Remote/Telecommuter

Job Requirements:

  • Ensure billing inventory is managed to the process activity metrics and financial goals as set by the company by working closely with Billers, Team Leads, and Senior Management.
  • Responsible for ensuring that client relationships are managed proactively and professionally, ensuring that contacts made by his/her unit with client partners is accomplished in a way that facilitates the overall goals of the unit and the company
  • Participate in client meetings with focus on performance reporting and issue resolution
  • Facilitate implementation of new billing contracts
  • Maintain customer service expectations internally and externally
  • Manage agency relationships to affect billing resolution
  • Manage all resources within budget
  • Respond appropriately and timely to any questions on policies or procedures
  • Must be familiar with management reports and monitor for accuracy for each facility
  • Identify training needs and assist in conducting training for new staff as well as ongoing/updated training for current staff
  • Mentor staff and encourage ongoing growth opportunities within Chamberlin Edmonds
  • Responsible for documentation of employee performance, feedback to employee, as well as development of any performance improvement plans to ensure excellent customer service
  • Ensure that all compliance rules are adhered to
  • Forecast staffing needs and recruit, interview and select new employees

Minimum Requirements:

  • 5+ years experience with Georgia Medicaid billing guidelines and 3+ years experience managing a team of at least 15-20 people.

Education:

  • Bachelor’s Degree Required, MBA preferred

Critical Skills:

  • Demonstrated supervisory experience including interviewing, hiring, training and discipline experience in developing operating plans and successfully managing within budgetary parameters
  • Experience or ability to establish qualitative and quantitative performance measures for all employees and experience in providing ongoing feedback
  • Operations experience in a large support organization
  • Previous work experience in a start-up environment
  • Process development experience
  • Strong Excel and PowerPoint
  • Experience with Business Objects
  • Experience establishing a partnership approach with customers/clients/co-workers to accomplish goals and exceed performance expectations
  • Experience establishing a team management work structure to accomplish performance goals

Join our team today where we are creating a better coordinated, increasingly collaborative, and more efficient healthcare system!

Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Statement

Apply for job

items.title: Head of Data Science, Insights and Analytics
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=80, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote
  • NEW YORK, SAN FRANCISCO, OR REMOTE W/US
  • ENGINEERING
  • FULL-TIME

Medium’s mission is to help people deepen their understanding of the world and discover ideas that matter. We are creating the best place for reading and writing on the internet—a place where today’s smartest writers, thinkers, experts, and storytellers can share big, interesting ideas.

Data Science and Business Analysis are two central teams responsible for gathering and translating data into insights that improve Medium for our readers, writers, and company, by enabling insights-driven decision making.

We are looking for a Data Science leader that empowers others to make creative and strategic decisions. You will build teams, tools, and processes that remove barriers to entry and empower others to do analysis and make smarter decisions. Our definition of tools is wide. It can be anything from a tool that lets us run prescriptive modeling on reader retention, to a thinking framework around how to determine if a story is of high quality or not.

The role reports directly to the COO, and together with him, you will help the entire executive team continue to deepen understanding of opportunities in our business, and create strategies and tactics to capture those opportunities, across all Departments.

What will you do?

  • Build and be responsible for the Data Science and Business Analysis organizations at Medium
  • Champion a culture of data informed decision-making, hypothesis-driven experimentation, and in doing so you will be responsible for the practices of data collection, management and use
  • Identify and construct the metrics to measure our objectives, build data pipelines, support Looker integration, and craft dashboards to glean insights for executives, working groups and the company at large
  • Educate partners and make strategic recommendations where needed, creating clarity about priorities and appropriate resource allocation along the way
  • Be the gatekeeper and guide of how we measure and understand our sophisticated system; you and your team will share a “state of the system” presentation every other week, and frequently publish insights on Medium to keep the company engaged and informed
  • Work with a broad range of cross-functional leaders in engineering, product, design, editorial, finance and the executive team to understand how our readers and writers interact with our products and where the major opportunities for growth are. Together, you and your team will help the company and its departments define priorities and turn analysis into recommendations and action that lead to continued growth rates.

Who you are:

  • A forward-thinking individual with a growth plan for the Data Science team and Analytics.
  • Committed to building diverse and inclusive organizations; a facilitator who encourages voices from all sides and backgrounds
  • Tenacious leader with a strong desire to develop and hire amazing managers and teams.
  • Deep understanding of business modeling and how data science informs business decisions
  • Strong customer focus and the ability to communicate complex or challenging messages effectively to a variety of audiences
  • You have a desire to build a team culture that balances practicality with rigor, skepticism with optimism, modeling data-driven decision making for all of Medium
  • A coach, crafting multi-disciplinary teams to make smart timely decisions.
  • You are a listener and a teacher who can help others define the best way to get answers to their priority business challenges

Requirements:

  • Deep technical expertise in Data Science, Product and Business Analysis or related fields.
  • Recognized leader with over 10 years of successful Data Science and/or analytical team management in dynamic start up growth environments (ideally tech / media companies)
  • You have the ability to instill a user-focused attitude within the data science organization, making sure we deeply understand our users, experiment and validate hypotheses before building
  • Executive-level presence and decision making experience
  • Experience balancing the demands and expectations of a broad and diverse set of partners, and have worked collaboratively at multiple levels of the organization to get things done
  • Strong recruiting and people management skills, as well as experience mentoring teams and managers to high performance
  • Ability to articulate a compelling vision for the future of data science, the trends within Medium’s user model, and the skills to guide the team to execute on this vision
  • Expert-level communication and collaboration skills; you model behavior by leading by example through and resolving inter-team conflict
  • Lead within a lean, highly effective organization, making strategic trade-offs, and prioritize effectively

Interested? We would love to hear from you.

This position is based in San Francisco. At Medium, we foster an inclusive, supportive, fun yet challenging team environment. We value having a team that is made up of a diverse set of backgrounds and respect the healthy expression of diverse opinions. We embrace experimentation and the examination of all kinds of ideas through reasoning and testing. Come join us as we continue to change the world of digital media.

Medium is an equal opportunity employer.

Apply for job

items.content:
Head of Developer Adoption

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Industry: Cryptocurrency
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Arweave – Berlin, Germany

Remote details

Office Location: Berlin, Germany. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

java
python
erlang

Job description

Head of Developer Adoption




ON-SITE OR REMOTE – FULL TIME

Overview

Arweave is a permanent information storage network, built on a new type of blockchain called a blockweave. We are working to solve the problem of the ‘memory hole’, as formulated by George Orwell in Nineteen Eighty-Four, by building the first data storage medium that truly never forgets. Arweave works by rewarding network participants for contributing hard disk space to the network, in a similar fashion to proof of work in Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.

What you’ll do

Being Head of Developer Adoption at Arweave will require you to manage our team of developer advocates, as they grow and strengthen the Arweave developer community. Together with this team, you will: 

  • Devise, execute, evaluate and refine creative developer acquisition strategies.
  • Build and refine developer reward programmes for incentivising adoption of the Arweave network, focussing on tangible, clear outcomes.
  • Manage relationship life cycles with individual community members that apply for our grant and investment programmes, from sourcing to completion.


About Yourself

You are a strong communicator, work well in distributed teams and have proven technical aptitudes. Crucially, you have played a pivotal role in gaining the adoption of a developer-focused protocol/product at least once before. 

About Us

By providing permanent, low-cost, and truly censorship-resistant data storage for everyone, we strive to democratise the information space. To achieve this, our team has built and now supports an online, open source, blockchain-based network providing decentralised data storage distributed worldwide. 

  • We’re an English-language team of very skilled and highly motivated entrepreneurs and hackers with diverse academic and professional backgrounds.
  • In spring 2018, we graduated from the Techstars Berlin accelerator programme and have access to a worldwide network of expert advisors and investors.
  • We count with the support of notable investors like Andreessen Horowitz, Union Square Ventures, Multicoin Capital and Coinbase Ventures. You can read recent coverage about Arweave here and here.

Arweave is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from everybody.

Easy apply

About Arweave

We work fast, we are thorough, we work as a team. We come from multiple countries, but are all passionate about decentralisation and web 3.

Benefits

  • Holiday allowance
  • Professional development stipend
  • Beverages and Snacks

items.title: Growth Machine: SEO Project Manager
items.content:
SEO Project Manager

Description

Growth Machine is expanding quickly, and we need your help to continue being the best SEO and content marketing agency on the internet.

We’re hiring a SEO project manager to lead client projects focused on SEO and content marketing. You'll work closely with our operations, editorial, and link building teams to ensure our clients are getting the white glove service we pride ourselves on, and that we're delivering premium content that earns our clients the top spots in Google for the search terms relevant to their business.

You'll be responsible for nurturing the client relationship and establishing the successful momentum of new and ongoing projects, and you'll personally oversee accounts worth over $1mm in annual revenue. You'll also be responsible for implementing new systems as necessary (or improving existing ones) to make sure we are operating as seamlessly and efficiently as we can, and producing great results on a large scale.

This is the perfect role for someone experienced in project management, account management, and campaign planning within an agency environment, particularly if you have experience in content marketing specifically, and are excited by the idea of helping a dynamic internet-based company grow quickly. You'll be given a huge amount of freedom to grow this part of our business, so if that kind of ownership excites you, read on.


Your Responsibilities

The Project Manager's job is to make sure that everything is running smoothly, seamlessly, and on schedule at all times. To do that, the manager has to split their time between coordinating the editorial planning process and being available for clients' needs. Here's what you'd be responsible for:

Project Management, and Editorial Strategy Responsibilities

  • Perform keyword research, and create and manage content plans for up to 20 clients in multiple industries.
  • Stay one step ahead of the writers and editors by making sure each article for each client is thought through ahead of time, and provide everything they need in advance so they can complete the article without issues or delays.
  • Organize content plans in Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, and Asana, making sure every editorial calendar is up to date, and planned out sufficiently in advance, at all times.
  • Assist the editors in sourcing and screening writers to find the perfect fit for our projects.
  • Miscellaneous problem solving as the point person for writers' and editors' concerns, questions, scheduling issues, and anything else related to the editorial plan and schedule.
Client Relationship Management Responsibilities:

  • Serve as the primary contact for your clients at Growth Machine. That means managing the relationship from the moment the contract is signed through the lifecycle of the project. Touch-points would include: leading client calls; answering questions, allaying concerns, and requests; coordinate changes to the content plan as requested by clients; and more as needed. We pride ourselves on the white glove service we offer our clients, and you would be free to adjust and improve the process as you see fit.
  • Learn the client's category and business inside and out, and employ a strategic approach to planning content, analyzing project performance, and reporting results.
  • Serve as the liaison between clients and the writing team during the ramp up period between project kickoff and beginning of publishing.
  • Deliver weekly progress updates (via email) for clients on the status of their project.
Requirements

  • You're a critical thinker, always looking for ways to improve a process or creatively solve a problem.
  • You have an insatiable thirst for organization and efficiency, and a keen eye for detail.
  • Prioritizing comes easily to you. You're detail-oriented, organized, and efficient, you don't flinch when five different people need five different things from you at the same time, and you're not intimidated by juggling a lot of different projects and responsibilities at once.
  • You have a proven track record of client relationship management in an agency - or similarly fast-paced - environment.
  • You have great communication and people skills, and you're experienced in and comfortable managing client expectations and making sure clients are well taken care of.
  • You can't help but take ownership of your job. You're always looking for ways to improve the process, whether by adjusting, automating, or another way.
  • You're a flexible and agile. You don't bat an eye at a fast pace or a rapidly growing and changing work environment.
  • You're capable of working autonomously. You're happy with the freedom and you don’t need or want to be managed.
  • You're friendly, eager to jump in and make the job your own, and love to contribute to tangible business growth and success.
Benefits

  • Remote Work: Some of us are based in Austin, but you don't have to be. You can work from anywhere in a US timezone.
  • Health Insurance: Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance 100% covered for you and 50% for your family.
  • Life Insurance: We cover life insurance for 2x your salary up to 200k, and you can add up to 500k in additional coverage.
  • 401k: You'll have access to a 401k with a 6% company match.
  • Profit Sharing: Each quarter we're profitable, a portion of that profit is split amongst the team.
  • Vacation and Holiday: 20 days paid vacation time, and we take off all major holidays, including a week over the New Year. Additional days per year with the company.
  • Team Retreats: Team trips each year to cities like Austin, LA, Chicago to get some time together in person.

items.title: Live Operations Manager
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote
  • REMOTE
  • PRODUCT

About Highrise

Highrise is a mobile game and community that generates meaningful human connections on a massive scale. In Highrise, people can make avatars, design art and environments and meet new friends. We are building on the spirit of applications like Animal Crossing, The Sims, Minecraft, Habbo Hotel and Second Life.

Over 3 million people create avatars, chat and make friends in Highrise. We are a fully remote team of 25 backed by YCombinator, Bessemer, Maveron and other leading investors.

About the Role

Do you love games, online communities and/or social media? Do you want to help create content for millions of users? Do you want to join a fast-growing mobile application that sits at the intersection of gaming and social media?

If you answered yes to all of the above, you should join our fast-growing team at Highrise!

We’re looking for someone to take over the entirety of Live Operations at Highrise. This is a hugely important role that interfaces with all teams in the company: Product, Art, Engineering, Support and Community. As a core member of the product team, you’ll coordinate new events and content in the Highrise world while coming up with wild new ideas to entertain our fast-growing audience.

As Live Ops Manager, you will…

  • Work closely with the Art team to establish weekly event ideas and goals.
  • Empower team members to invent new, engaging forms of content inside Highrise.
  • Create high frequency, aggressive schedules for on-going content.
  • Coordinate and support content creation efforts across all disciplines to meet release deadlines.
  • Implement assets and supporting data for live content.
  • Organize testing efforts for live content.
  • Be excited to serve our players and offer them exciting new experiences!

The core values that we are looking for are…

  • Hard-working: You have an “above and beyond” work ethic driven by a desire to grow and succeed.
  • Player-centric: You care deeply about our users and want to make the best possible game for them.
  • Takes Ownership: You take ownership over your role/task and define your own goals and objectives.
  • Reliable: You are willing to be available when needed, sometimes at odd times and especially in moments of crisis.
  • Highly Organized: You will be juggling lots of different assets and data, which requires airtight organization.
  • Good with Data: You have strong competency with excel/sheets, JSON and any other data-related formats.
  • Analytical: You can diagnose event performance and find ways to improve game design and events in Highrise.
  • Creative: You can come up with event ideas using building blocks established by the mechanics in Highrise.

To be successful in this role, we’d expect you to…

  • Have 3+ years’ experience managing product or content deadlines.
  • Have 3+ years’ experience designing games, events or product features.
  • Be an excellent English writer.
  • Communicate honestly and effectively with people across the entire company.
  • Go out of your way to help the team and others.
  • Be able to work well remotely, including managing your own schedule effectively.

Within 3 months, you’ll…

  • Set up all events and live content in Highrise.
  • Meet with Art and Product teams weekly to plan new content.
  • Contribute to product idea and feature discussions.
  • Actively communicate with users via our app and Discord.
  • Establish a strong presence in the Highrise community.

Within 6 months, you’ll…

  • Easily set up all events and live content in Highrise, possibly outsourcing this work.
  • Regularly tune and improve events in Highrise.
  • Come up with new event ideas using the building blocks available to you.
  • Help the Support and Community teams accomplish their work.
  • Meaningfully contribute to Product discussions to come up with features that move the app forward.
Apply for job

items.title: Vice President of Product
items.content:
Remote
  • REMOTE
  • Product
  • United States
  • Full time

OVERVIEW

Description

What’s the opportunity?

We are looking for a VP of Product to lead our world-class product organization. You will continually invent, define, and build on the Qualio platform.

In this role, you will be responsible for evolving the strategic vision of the company and creating alignment across the organization. You will determine priorities, develop the product roadmap, and carry plans forward to implementation. You’ll own product definition, creation, implementation, and improvement end-to-end. In addition, you will lead the hiring and processes required to be successful.

What will I be doing?

  • Set the vision for the Product Management team and take a leading role in setting the vision of the company, providing strategic direction for the product, and influencing the direction of other groups in Qualio.
  • Identify and hire the most critical positions on the Product Management team. Create the identity for the Product Management team and connect that identity back to the company.
  • Influence goal-setting within and outside of the Product Management team for both individuals and teams.
  • Build and drive cross-team processes which systematically advance our understanding of customer requirements and their businesses processes.
  • Create metrics representing business performance and customer satisfaction and use those metrics to drive behavior and make data-driven decisions.
  • Define the value proposition of the Product Management team and represent that value to stakeholders through the delivery of appropriate metrics and performance indicators that measure progress against your strategy.
  • Challenge existing standards of product excellence and propose new standards continuously. Create a culture of continuous, systematic improvement within the Product Management team.
  • Anticipate potential sources of failure, drive improvements to existing product features, and create new ones to overcome any setbacks.
  • Serve as sponsor and champion of cross-company initiatives.

Requirements

What skills do I need?

  • 10+ years experience in product management in B2B cloud SaaS applications
  • Passion for leading, mentoring, and scaling product teams to reach their full potential
  • A healthy level of skepticism and an analytical nature with the ability to quickly absorb and analyze unfamiliar information to make decisions that are supported by sound evidence
  • Prioritization and decision-making in complex situations with competing inputs
  • Deep understanding of the end-to-end product development process
  • Technical background or extensive experience with the technical side of the product development process
  • Adept in user research, data-driven experimentation, sprints, and rapid iteration
  • Accomplished Project Management experience, with ability to identify, create, and execute on a project plan
  • Experience designing and building metrics for product engagement and customer satisfaction
  • Experience managing feature sets and requirements in a complex domain or marketplace
  • Experience developing software products in a regulated space, subject to the constraints and norms of the industry.
  • Product development experience in the medical device, pharmaceutical, or other life science industries a plus.

…And be aligned with our values:

  • Seek Ownership – We thrive on being trusted, on freedom, and on being able to make an impact. We live up to verbal and written commitments and adjust quickly to changing priorities.
  • Customer-centric – We prioritize creating positive customer experiences with every decision and every action.
  • Always Curious – We are voracious learners who are open to new ideas and can integrate them into our professional and personal lives quickly.
  • Intentional Communication – We believe in running an open company that communicates early and often, with a focus on clarity.
  • Team Players – We earn trust and support each other. We seek what is best for the company rather than what is best for ourselves or our group.

Benefits

In addition to playing an important role in building Qualio, you’ll receive:

  • Generous health and retirement benefits;
  • Competitive salary;
  • Unlimited PTO;
  • Distributed, office-agnostic work environment;
  • And make a real difference through helping life-saving products to get to market.
Apply for job

items.title: ManyPixels: Operations Manager
items.content:
Operations Manager


About ManyPixels 
ManyPixels provides graphic design services to SMEs, agencies and marketing teams all around the world. For a monthly fee, our customers get direct access to our team of 25 talented designers and we help them with a large range of projects: digital graphics, web design, illustrations, branding, etc. 

Our team is fully distributed across Europe and Asia, while most of our customers are in the US. 

We have been around for 2+ years and are growing fast as we are solving a very common and painful problem: finding a talented, affordable and reliable freelance designer is hard. With ManyPixels, you can submit your design request today and get it back tomorrow. 


About the role 
You will be wearing many hats and hold a large range of small and large responsibilities. You will hold a key role with both our designers and our customers. You will work right next to the CEO and will be in charge of the day-to-day and the development of new initiatives across 3 functions: operations, HR and customer success/support. 

At first you will be handling a lot by yourself, with the help of the CEO and 2 project managers, but as we grow the idea is to build a larger team and divide the different responsibilities. 

The main areas of focus will be growing and managing our design teams while ensuring high quality and short turnaround time, improving our customer success efforts and developing new service offerings. 

This position is best suited for a self-driven individual with a do-it mentality, things will move fast and it will be up to you to make it happen. This is an opportunity to really buy into the vision of a young and growing company and become a part of the core team in the long run. 


What you will work on 
  • Developing and executing operational, HR and customer success processes
  • Supervising an existing team of 25 designers
  • Supporting our customers on daily basis with the help of 2 project managers
  • Hire, onboard, train, manage and review new design teams across multiple countries and timezones
  • Collaborating with the CEO on improving our current service offerings as well as launching new ones
  • Collaborating with the developer on improving our current platform as well as launching new features

Our ideal candidate 
  • You have 4+ years of experience in a past operational, HR or customer success role
  • You have prior experience hiring and managing a team, preferably in a remote environment
  • Your have prior experience setting up new processes, documentations and KPIs
  • You have experience in graphic design or have a strong interest in learning more about the industry
  • You are a people person and an excellent communicator with both internal and external parties
  • You are familiar with the usual tools of a remote team: Asana, Slack, Notion, etc but are also interested in setting up new ones (ATS, HR, training)
  • You are comfortable in a fast-paced environment

Benefits 
  • Full-time remote job
  • Join a growing bootstrapped startup with a lot of potential
  • Autonomy to implement ideas and have a significant impact
  • 20 days of paid time off per year

Location 
  • Preferably European Time Zone

items.title: VP of Engineering
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=5, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Ably is the world’s fastest Data Stream Network (DSN) spread over 14 data centers and 175+ points of presence. Each day we stream billions of realtime messages to millions of end-users for thousands of developers around the world. Some of the things our platform powers: HubSpot’s chat and collaboration products, live score updates for millions of Australian Open tennis fans, live transit updates for three million Chicagoans. Working at Ably means helping to build the infrastructure that will power and shape the future of the internet. 


To see what life’s like at Ably, check out our careers page at www.ably.io/careers. 


What we do


Ably’s engineering team is deeply technical, collectively bringing a wealth of experience and broad technology skills across infrastructure, security, distributed systems, and much more. The calibre of the code we produce is what excites and motivates us each day. If you enjoy solving hard distributed system problems that are mostly platform agnostic and theoretical in nature, then you'll love working at Ably. You’ll work in a team that is small enough to be truly agile, delivering APIs that power some of the biggest tech, businesses and consumer brands in the world. 



In this role


Ably is an engineering company at its heart. Our audience ranges from software engineers to CIOs and it’s our job to make sure the world knows about Ably.


You’ll lead the engineering team that is responsible for the core Ably services, including global infrastructure, realtime messaging fabric, client software and various supporting services.


You’ll report to the CEO, working under the technical authority of the CTO, and have responsibility for all aspects of delivery of the core service.


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with our CTO and team technical leads in to design and architect our infrastructure, services and client software;

  • Work in coordination with Ably’s internal customers (head of product and head of developer relations) to formulate the technology roadmap;

  • Manage, prioritise and optimise the backlog to allow us to deliver against this roadmap;

  • Build, lead and develop the engineering team;

  • Define and promote the application of the development processes and all supporting resources, infrastructure etc.



Requirements



You will be successful if you:



  • Are an inspiring leader who can recruit, develop and retain developers in the most competitive technology landscape;

  • Proven experience in building high-performance teams and scalable best-practices in an engineering organisation;

  • Have experience with identifying, evaluating, and removing blockers for engineering teams;

  • Have exceptional planning and execution capacity with an ability to monitor progress, take corrective action when necessary and communicate changes;

  • Are a seasoned software practitioner with a demonstrable track record of technical execution and process-based delivery;

  • Have broad and relevant technical experience in the areas relevant to the Ably product and service, particularly cloud-native architectures and infrastructure, distributed systems, and operation of those systems in a production setting.

  • Highly proficient programmer, ideally with experience of both dynamic and statically-typed languages including go, nodejs, elixir and/or ruby.


Nice to have skills and experience:



  • Have recent and directly relevant technical experience in areas such as distributed and fault-tolerant systems, realtime protocols and services;

  • Our team are active open source contributors and are encouraged to do this as part of their role at Ably.  Being an active contributor to the open source community is beneficial.


What’s it like to work at Ably?


Ably is entering a new phase of growth led by an experienced senior team from the likes of Econsultancy and ThoughtWorks. You’ll be part of a successful, highly motivated, and extremely collaborative team. To provide the infrastructure required for the next generation of the internet, to tell the world about it, and to support everyone inside Ably to do so we hire people who are ready and capable of taking on challenging problems in a high-growth environment. We want to work in a company of inclusive people who treat each other well. We’re building a company with a diverse set of people who value:



  • Ownership and impact of work. You have real autonomy and ownership over your work with a visible impact inside Ably, and externally on products powered by Ably that you use in your daily life.

  • An environment to thrive. Modern, comfy office in the heart of Old Street. Excellent transport links, lots of great food, bars and restaurants nearby, and multiple work spaces to match your working style.

  • Truly flexible working and not just lip service. We like people to be in the office most of the time, but work should also fit around life and individual ways of working so you’re free to mold hours and environment to your needs.

  • Work is varied and challenging as we’re solving hard, complex problems that push the limits of what’s possible with today’s software and infrastructure.


What's in it for you?



  • A good, competitive salary

  • Flexibility: work from home for up to two days per week (when we go back to normal!)

  • Your choice of high quality tech kit to work on

  • Health insurance

  • ClassPass membership

  • Cycle to work

  • Company contributions towards your pension

  • Regular company away days and social events

  • Weekly team breakfast or lunch

  • Free drinks and snacks in the office

  • Ongoing professional development (training, events, conferences), including an assigned budget

  • 25 days of paid annual leave (33 days including bank holidays)


Ably has a culture that values employee freedom and responsibility. Apply to talk to us to see if this role on an impactful and collaborative team is right for you.

items.title: Remote Virtual Events Manager
items.content:
Blue Sky eLearn an award-winning Learning Management Systems and Virtual Events Services company is hiring a Virtual Events Manager. 

As a Virtual Event Manager at Blue Sky eLearn, you will work with our clients to ensure the successful execution of their virtual events, including webinars, webcasts, and remote recordings. Our virtual event managers achieve this through understanding client business goals and objectives, developing strong rapport, and executing against a defined event schedule. As a member of the Client Services team, you will manage a portfolio of virtual event projects with a diverse set of clients, and as the main point of contact for our clients’ events, you will be a critical player in driving long-term client success and demonstrating the value of the Blue Sky solution.

You will work cross-functionally with multiple internal teams to develop a keen understanding of customers’ unique business needs and challenges and identify and manage any internal resources necessary to realize the clients’ goals.

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by a generous compensation plan. Includes base salary, medical, dental, vision benefits, and a 401(k) program. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

Position located at either our headquarters office in San Diego, or your home office.


Responsibilities:

Understand and manage project scope as agreed with the client and ensure that it is fully executed by both Blue Sky and client

Communicate with clients to facilitate scheduling, training, and delivery of virtual events

Create and maintain required project artifacts including project schedule, training materials, project requirements documents, and presentations for various discussions

Effectively communicate project expectations and progress to our clients, team members, and executive team in a timely and clear manner

Continually strive to improve virtual event management processes by enhancing best practices and proactively identifying areas of improvement

Understand Blue Sky products and how platform updates will impact product set-up


Qualifications:

1+ years relevant experience
Preferred experience: Virtual events management or project management

Strong quantitative/analytical skills

Experience defining and documenting processes, and driving continuous improvement to processes via process measurement/metrics

Perceptive, collaborative and customer-orientated, with demonstrated ability to build strong relationships with clients and internal stakeholders to ensure successful project execution

Flexible, energetic, with a strong sense of entrepreneurship, creative mind, ability to think out-of-the-box

A natural inclination to resolve customer problems and help them be highly successful


Extra Credit:

Knowledge of the virtual events industry

PMP or other professional project management certification or credentialing

Experience with Salesforce

Thirst for proactively learning and testing functionality of our products to meet customers’ unique needs

Work with a future-focused company who values your time and input. Bring your innovative thinking and proactive problem-solving to our friendly, fast-paced workplace. Our competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits packages ensure a happy, healthy workforce. We foster a collaborative open culture where you’ll be encouraged to think long-term as you learn and grow with us.

This is a full time position

items.content:

Role: Scrum Master / Agile Business Analyst
Location: Cardiff (Remote initially)

Acorn Recruitment is excited to working with a real innovator in the tech industry. As they scale their main product and also look to build out a product in response to the Covid pandemic, they are looking for their next superstar employees to join them.

They are looking for a passionate hybrid BA / Scrum Master, who has experience gathering requirements from stakeholders. You will have experience in an agile environment, ideally one that is part of a small, cutting edge tech company. You will facilitate scrums whilst also producing Epics, Features, Stories and Wireframes.

You would be working in a vibrant yet relaxed tech-driven environment, where passion and enthusiasm for seeing the business succeed is absolutely paramount. Following the initial onboarding period, you will be given flexibility to work how best suits you and given the support you need to develop and grow with the business.

Skills Required

  • Experience with Epics / Features / Stories / Wireframing.
  • Experience running scrums and coaching developers.
  • Experience gathering requirements.
  • Experience within small, agile tech companies that are delivering apps / software is extremely desirable.

The successful candidate will receive:

  • Equity in the company
  • 25 days holiday with the option of flexible working once you've completed on-boarding and probation
  • Company pension
  • High quality mentoring from their Head of Engineering, leadership team and advisory board

If you are interested then please apply today or contact Ryan.Lewis@acornpeople.com for more information.

Acorn Recruitment acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment.
Cardiff
Permanent
£35,000 a year

items.content:
Shogun Labs

Technical Project Manager

We Are… Shogun, and we're on a mission to help people create the best eCommerce experiences in the world. We were in the Winter 2018 batch of Y-Combinator, we just raised a Series A investment, we have over 10,000 active paying clients, and we're preparing to launch a new product in 2020 (you can read more in Tech Crunch). Our teams are fully distributed and global (check out our team page)! We have no office, so we are looking for team members that are comfortable with and motivated by the opportunity to work remotely. Location We are a truly global team and its important for the person in this role to have overlap with both squads in order to be effective and successful. On the west we have people from GMT-5 to GMT. On the east have people from GMT+2 to GMT+8. About You.. * You get things done. * You are comfortable with ambiguity. * You know best practices of different agile methodologies, but you are not set on one, you can apply the best practices in a startup, async environment. * You work async. You use meetings strategically. * You understand tech, are familiar with the latest web technologies, and you have previous coding experience. * You understand startups are chaotic and you kind of like it. You are able to navigate, reign in and thrive in the chaos. In this role you will... * Help the squads deliver in a fast-paced environment where there is not a lot of process and documentation to guide you. * Work with two squads in different timezones. * Get the needs from product/support/design/growth/engineering and break down the work into user stories and tasks that are clear for the engineering team to deliver. * Validate the specs and fulfill the missing parts. Sometimes, you will write the specs by yourself. * Organize backlogs, milestones, epics, and iterations. * Host the iteration ceremonies (the less, the better). * Communicate and create visibility for the entire company on what the squads are shipping. You Have * 2+ years of working experience as a technical project manager in a startup or similar environment. * Working knowledge or proven understanding of software development lifecycle. * Background in engineering, quality assurance or design. * Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Our Stack * Clubhouse for managing stories * Slack for communication * Notion for documentation * Geekbot for daily updates * See more on stackshare We Offer * Competitive salary * Benefits (vary by location) * A highly skilled and dedicated team that is fun to work with. * Remote work – We are a fully distributed team * Occasionally, we hire on a full time contractor basis to begin with. Team members enjoy the same opportunities for great compensation, full time positions, equity, and consideration, regardless of location. Our Values * Work in the open: Operate with high integrity and choose what's right over what's easy. Be transparent as a company and with each other. * People are People: Treat yourself, colleagues, and customers with dignity, empathy, and respect. Start from a presumption of positive intent. * Win and grow together: Strive to be the best, individually and as a team. Support and encourage each other. Seek opportunities for growth. Shogun supports workplace diversity and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity/expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class

hiringOrganization.name: Shogun Labs, Inc – No office location

items.content:
Technical Project Manager

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Product Manager
Industry: eCommerce, Enterprise Software, Web Technology
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Shogun Labs, Inc – No office location

Technologies

project-management

Job description

We Are…

Shogun, and we're on a mission to help people create the best eCommerce experiences in the world.

We were in the Winter 2018 batch of Y-Combinator, we just raised a Series A investment, we have over 10,000 active paying clients, and we're preparing to launch a new product in 2020 (you can read more in Tech Crunch).

Our teams are fully distributed and global (check out our team page)! We have no office, so we are looking for team members that are comfortable with and motivated by the opportunity to work remotely.

Location

We are a truly global team and its important for the person in this role to have overlap with both squads in order to be effective and successful. On the west we have people from GMT-5 to GMT. On the east have people from GMT+2 to GMT+8.

About You..

  • You get things done.
  • You are comfortable with ambiguity.
  • You know best practices of different agile methodologies, but you are not set on one, you can apply the best practices in a startup, async environment.
  • You work async. You use meetings strategically.
  • You understand tech, are familiar with the latest web technologies, and you have previous coding experience.
  • You understand startups are chaotic and you kind of like it. You are able to navigate, reign in and thrive in the chaos.

In this role you will...

  • Help the squads deliver in a fast-paced environment where there is not a lot of process and documentation to guide you.
  • Work with two squads in different timezones.
  • Get the needs from product/support/design/growth/engineering and break down the work into user stories and tasks that are clear for the engineering team to deliver.
  • Validate the specs and fulfill the missing parts. Sometimes, you will write the specs by yourself.
  • Organize backlogs, milestones, epics, and iterations.
  • Host the iteration ceremonies (the less, the better).
  • Communicate and create visibility for the entire company on what the squads are shipping.

You Have

  • 2+ years of working experience as a technical project manager in a startup or similar environment.
  • Working knowledge or proven understanding of software development lifecycle.
  • Background in engineering, quality assurance or design.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Our Stack

  • Clubhouse for managing stories
  • Slack for communication
  • Notion for documentation
  • Geekbot for daily updates
  • See more on stackshare

We Offer

  • Competitive salary
  • Benefits (vary by location)
  • A highly skilled and dedicated team that is fun to work with.
  • Remote work – We are a fully distributed team
  • Occasionally, we hire on a full time contractor basis to begin with. Team members enjoy the same opportunities for great compensation, full time positions, equity, and consideration, regardless of location.

Our Values

  • Work in the open: Operate with high integrity and choose what's right over what's easy. Be transparent as a company and with each other.
  • People are People: Treat yourself, colleagues, and customers with dignity, empathy, and respect. Start from a presumption of positive intent.
  • Win and grow together: Strive to be the best, individually and as a team. Support and encourage each other. Seek opportunities for growth.

Shogun supports workplace diversity and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity/expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class

Apply

About Shogun Labs, Inc

Shogun is looking for new team members! We are a tight knit distributed team of talented people who enjoy making delightful software experiences. We take pride in being bootstrapped to profitability, and we are backed by Y-Combinator and Initialized Capital. Come join us as we dive into the next evolution of our company. We can offer strong compensation and flexibility with our fully remote and globally distributed team. Most of all, we can promise you a great working environment with leadership who genuinely care about their team members.

Benefits

  • Fully remote, globally distributed
  • Annual international company retreats & team retreats
  • Competitive pay
  • Results-oriented work environment

items.content:
SmartContract - Building Chainlink | https://chain.link

Smart contracts are on track to revolutionize how all agreements work, through an entirely new system of technologically enforced contract guarantees. We are well recognized for providing highly secure and reliable blockchain connectivity to the world's largest enterprises such as Google, Oracle, SWIFT, and many more. This is a unique opportunity to join one of the top companies developing cutting-edge blockchain technology while working closely together with a team of experienced senior executives.

These roles are location agnostic anywhere in the world. Though we ask that you overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).

* Senior Security Engineer | Full-Time | REMOTE | https://careers.chain.link/o/senior-security-engineer ======================================================================================================

You will work directly with our engineers to improve the security of our open-source code base. You will partner closely with our leadership team as well as communicate and collaborate across the organization to design and implement company-wide security processes. In this role you will work on our risk program, coordinate response plans, drive the security council, and be in charge of fostering security culture at chainlink.

* Senior Developer in Test | Full-Time | REMOTE | https://careers.chain.link/o/senior-developer-in-test =======================================================================================================

You will be leading our efforts in designing and developing our test automation framework. You will play a key role on our Core team building out an integral part of our project and managing scalable best practices as it relates to testing. You will have the opportunity to work closely with our founders and ensure we are creating plans and tests that will lead us to the next phase of growth.

* Site Reliability Engineer | Full-Time | REMOTE | https://careers.chain.link/o/site-reliability-engineer-globa.... ================================================================================================================

You’ll work directly with the company’s CTO, CEO and a technical team of other senior engineers. You’ll develop and build highly scalable, secure, and reliable software that will change the way smart contracts function at a fundamental level. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and master the latest research concerning cryptography, blockchains, game theory, consensus algorithms, and decentralized applications.You'll join us in enabling the future architecture of Chainlink.

* Senior Software Engineer | Full-Time | REMOTE | https://careers.chain.link/o/senior-software-engineer-global ================================================================================================================

As a senior software engineer, you’ll work directly with the company’s CTO, CEO and a technical team of other senior engineers. You’ll develop and build highly scalable, secure, and reliable software that will change the way smart contracts function at a fundamental level. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and master the latest research concerning cryptography, blockchains, game theory, consensus algorithms, and decentralized applications. The core Chainlink client is written in GoLang and we are planning to rewrite some of the architecture using Rust. We live by an open-source ethos and believe in giving back to the community.

We are hiring for other positions too, check https://careers.chain.link/ for more information!

items.content:
Remote
  • Delivery

Job description

Oven Bits is seeking a Technical Project Lead to guide clients + projects towards successful builds, feature releases and re-platforming. Beyond project plans and weekly facilitation, it’s important for this person to effectively lead a remote team, communicate well with enterprise-level clients and have a genuine enthusiasm for their craft!

We’re looking for someone who understands how to determine what to build, the order to build it in, potential gotchas on projects, large-scale software platforms and how to get things done. Our team is passionate about creating world-class apps (like this, this and this) and we want you to make us even better. If this sounds like it might fit what you’re looking for too, read on, and get in touch.

EQ + IQ

We work within numerous levels of mid-to-large companies. It takes a strong relational range to connect with Directors, VPs and C-suites alike. We want someone that can read a room, relate to different people and discern what matters to each of their roles when communicating solutions.

About Oven Bits

Oven Bits is a highly personable design and engineering agency based in Texas. We’re passionate about creating world-class software that people enjoy using (read: it works, not just looks great). We’re a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, designers and other great folks. Our work has been featured in Techcrunch, Mashable, US Weekly, CBS News, Texas Monthly and The Today Show. We’re proud to have a portfolio of work that viewed by millions of people every week and that’s been featured 25+ times in the Apple App Store and Google Play. At the end of the day, we view this as our life’s work and not just our work life.

Culture + Remote Work

At Oven Bits, we’re not only passionate about our craft, but also about our culture. We believe in a thoughtful mix of work, play and growth…and our company values reflect this. 

Our remote environment allows people to spend more time in the places they most enjoy.

Outcomes

  • Communicate exceptionally well with enterprise clients
  • Can figure things out and get stuff done
  • Manage projects to be on-time, on-budget and with results
  • Clients enjoy working with them
  • Oven Bits team members enjoy working with and being led by them

Requirements

Prior Experience

  • Led a team to build at least 1 large-scale software project
  • Led a team to re-platform at least 1 large-scale 3rd party platform (commerce engine, CMS, CRM, Data Pipeline, etc)
  • Worked at an agency or with clients on large projects
  • Familiar with building integrated solutions, API integrations, SDKs and tech stacks
  • Nice To Have’s: Created a website or app’s strategy, have a background in design/code/strategy, other related functions

Competencies

  • Communication proficiency for in-person, phone and written forms.
  • Detail Oriented: able to manage multiple task and people against budgets and timelines.
  • Proactive Leadership: can recognize needs/opportunities and activate a group of people to pursue them
  • Follow-through on commitments. Lives up to verbal and written agreements, regardless of how.
  • Well Organized
  • Honesty/integrity. Does not cut corners ethically. Earns trust and maintains confidences. Does what is right, not just what is politically expedient. Speaks plainly and truthfully.
Apply for job

items.title: Contracts Manager
items.content:
Remote

Location: Remote

Summary

The Contracts Manager I will be responsible for providing contract management oversight to a biopharmaceutical client tasked with providing support in all aspects of purchasing goods and services (e.g. obtaining vendor quotes, statements of work preparation, purchase order submission, invoice resolution and ensuring compliance with client policy and procedures.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage procurement to payment process with biopharmaceutical client.
  • Manage requests for service, confirm budget availability, manage vendor cost tables, validate invoices, and prepare reports as needed.
  • Submit requests for CDAs and provide follow up with the legal department and to requesting parties.
  • Provide support in all aspects of purchasing goods and service (e.g. obtaining vendor quotes, statement of work preparation, purchase order submission, and invoice resolution)
  • Ensure compliance with client policies and procedures.

Required Knowledge and Skills:

  • Experience in purchasing or contract administration and understanding all aspects of the contracting process.
  • Ability to establish strong working relationships with a wide range of people. Candidate will be a team player – but also have the ability to use personal initiative and make your own decisions as well.
  • Well-organized and capable of meeting deadlines.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Cross-functional and cross-site team management experience.
  • Critical Thinking – Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
  • Working knowledge of Good Laboratory Practices (GLP), Good Clinical Practices (GCP)
  • Common and specialized computer software application proficiency and adaptability.

Education/Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in related field with a minimum of 2 years of industry-relevant purchasing or contract management experience. Very high attention to detail and excellent multi-tasking skills is required for success in this position.
Apply for job

items.content:
The Center for Enlightened Business is seeking a talented Marketing Project Manager with the ability to work remotely: 
 

Compensation:  55K 60K, depending on experience, and ability to produce and perform. This is a remote position. 
 

The Marketing Project Manager Role:

The Marketing Manager will perform a vital role within our business.  Their primary objective will be to help scale marketing and increase revenue from 1.5m to 10m in revenue by 2023 though organizing, managing, and executing on the strategic marketing vision.  

Marketing Project Manager Summary of Key Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with the CEO, organizing and executing on a variety of marketing projects and data reporting
  • Organize CEO marketing vision and execute it
  • Manage and coordinate consultants, copy writers, digital marketers, live events and promotions, email, content creation, and sales and marketing funnel building. 
  • Produce 4 calls per day, per sales person. 

Marketing Project Manager Required Skills & Experience:

  • Project management and coordination of multi-channel, project, and people marketing
  • Digital marketing  
  • Data collection and reporting 
  • Marketing calendar development and execution 
  • Paid advertisements (Print & digital) 
  • Budget and ROI attribution  
  • Tech savy  - CRMs , websites, funnel building, landing pages, APIs
  • Content coordination and distribution 
  • Mapping content to various sales stages 
  • High-level communication skills, written (copy writing and editing), verbal, and interpersonal. 

Bonus Experience: 

  • Event planning and managing 
  • Partner and affiliate marketing 
  • Branding  
  • Marketing and Project management certifications and courses 
  • Customer experience 
  • Working with executive level 
  • Presentation / webinar skills 
  • Teaching and coaching clients 
  • Meditation / Personal development courses and workshops 


The Ideal Candidate will:

  • Be a self starter who doesnt need management
  • Be proficient at getting work done on time at a high level
  • Be extremely organized and a meticulous executor
  • Thrive under pressure and in a fast paced environment
  • Be agile and adaptable, to meet the challenges of a hyper growth company
  • Be self-aware, heart-centered,  and hungry to make a meaningful impact on the world 
  • Be driven to meet and exceed goals 
     

About Center for Enlightened Business:

The Center for Enlightened Business is focused on making the world a better place through helping small business owners grow and evolve. We focus on serving and empowering accountants to use their financial and business knowledge to help guide and advise the small business community all over North America to have more success, make more money, and make the world a better place through the fulfillment of their dreams. We empower our clients through a combination of our decades of experience in helping accountants grow their firms in more meaningful ways and with our focus on the human element of business, teaching them to recognize the limitations in their thinking that prevent breakthrough results. In the process of empowering them, their firms grow, they earn more money, work fewer hours, do more meaningful and impactful work, enjoy their lives more, and even feel more peace in their lives

We care about each person we work with. Each life we change has a positive ripple effect as they end up changing the lives of their teams, their clients, their families, and their communities as a result of this work. We deliver our results through coaching and offer 2 very powerful programs that help us make the world a better place through the context of having a more Enlightened business conversation.
