items.title: Clevertech: Project Coordinator
items.content:
Project Coordinator

DESCRIPTION:

Clevertech is looking for someone with an innate intellectual curiosity and great people skills to join our fully remote team as a Project Coordinator.

We are looking for a team member to help us delight clients and produce success for our client projects. How? By being sensitive to and understanding client concerns and coordinating effective responses with members of the product development team. Your day will consist of working across several teams, attending daily stand-ups, assisting in the management of client expectations, working directly with clients as needed in regards to project features and functionality.

Our vision at Clevertech is to provide enterprises a world-class development team that executes on their most ambitious goals. Your demeanor, tone, and professionalism are the public face of Clevertech’s services. Attention to detail, being quick on your feet to problem solve, and superb communication skills are highly desired.


REQUIREMENTS:

You have a consistently positive attitude and are interested in learning new things. Excellent communication, analytical, and interpersonal skills are your best strengths. Being friendly isn’t enough. Prioritization and organization are also key factors for success in this role.

Experience Required:
  • Bachelor’s Degree at minimum is required
  • At least 3 years of professional work experience
  • Spectacular achievements with clients
  • Demonstrated ability to learn fast and solve unique challenges
  • Experience with the G Suite, GitHub and/or ZenHub a plus

Key Qualities:
  • Poised and professional demeanor with a high intellectual curiosity
  • Tech-savvy, yet no prior experience in a technical role required
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills: concise, articulate and polished
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-moving environment
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships


Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.
  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community
  • Health Insurance and 401k

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by people they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work


Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Clevertech's Career Growth Video

items.title: Cro Metrics: Director of Optimization
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Director of Optimization


As a Director of Optimization at Cro Metrics, you will be a player/coach overseeing a team of people who are hybrid product manager, strategic thinker, account manager, and data analyst. Your primary role is to enable our product managers to be successful. With your passion for helping your team be successful combined with your agency or client-facing experience, you’ll be able to quickly gain the respect of your team in showing them how it’s done while also helping them to develop the skills they’ll need to grow in their own careers. Product Managers spend much of their time interfacing with clients, designers, and engineers. On the client side, our Product Managers must be able to generate data-driven ideas that will improve revenue and other key metrics on client websites while being rooted in better understanding what the customer wants.


Our PMs lead all A/B testing and personalization experimentation for the client, which includes the following:
  • Partnering with the client for the ideation, prioritization, road-mapping, design, and approval process for all hypotheses generation and experimentation
  • Diving deep into the results to deliver the data story, learnings, and recommendations from the experiment
  • Collaborating with a remote team of engineers, designers, and other PMs to support experiment ideation and execution
  • Managing all aspects of the client relationship from daily experiment monitoring to kicking off the renewal process to evangelizing the value of Cro Metrics

The director must be able to do all of these things on their own and be focused on enabling their team to level up their skills. Expect about 5% travel as you visit key accounts regularly.


Experience and Skills
  • 10+ years of professional experience working in digital product management.
  • Experience working at an agency or as a freelancer is required.
  • 5+ years of experience managing others. This is where you will be spending the majority of your time.
  • Lifelong learner
  • Experience running A/B/n tests using leading testing platforms such as Optimizely, VWO, Google Optimize, Dynamic Yield, etc.
  • Strong presentation and communication skills
  • Passion for using data to improve user experiences
  • Built and delivered product roadmaps full of winning and losing ideas
  • Hands-on experience analyzing digital business data to inform decisions and plan strategically
  • Worked cross-functionally in a highly collaborative environment, preferably in a remote capacity
  • Genuinely like working with clients and their distributed stakeholder groups
  • Love product strategy, but obsessed with the details on execution

Company Benefits
  • 100% remote, continue to work from where you are based
  • Health insurance reimbursement allowance
  • Retirement plan with 4% company match (subject to a 3 month waiting period)
  • Professional gear (e.g. MacBook, monitor, and noise-canceling headset)
  • Annual All Hands trips
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Liberal vacation policy
  • Access to group and individual performance coaching sessions




Our positions are fully remote and to ensure compliance with all applicable labor laws, are open to U.S.-based applicants who are authorized to work in the U.S. only. Cro Metrics is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

items.title: Director of Registrar Services

hiringOrganization.name: Auguste Escoffier School of Culinary Arts

items.content:
Remote

Remote/Home Based or IL

Description

Auguste Escoffier School of Culinary Arts is a leading accredited provider of online and campus-based culinary training and education. The school’s professional programs offer the proven combination of a classic and contemporary approach to modern industry skills training as well as a sustainability-centered and business-focused curriculum. Professional programs in Culinary Arts and Pastry Arts are available online and at ground campuses in Austin, Texas, and Boulder, Colorado. Escoffier also offers enthusiast training online and on ground. If you’re looking for a dynamic, fast-paced growth opportunity, we’d like to hear from you. Learn more about us at www.escoffier.edu

GENERAL SUMMARY

The Director of Registrar Services is responsible for providing leadership to plan, organize and manage all of the activities related to the Records and Registration Department, including serving as the official keeper of the School’s student records.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Organize and administer the records, registration and graduation functions, including transcript evaluations in order to provide maximum service to students while ensuring efficient and effective workflow
  • Lead initiatives as determined by the Chief Academic Officer
  • Create and maintain best practices, policies and procedures that ensure efficient operations and compliance with regulatory requirements
  • Collaborate with the Lead Instructors and Executive Chefs to execute the coordination, evaluation and certification of all graduates
  • Responsible for collecting, recording, maintaining and reporting of student records within FERPA guidelines, e.g., grades, registration data, transcripts, mid-term verification, and associated audits. Maintain the accuracy, integrity, privacy and security of all academic records.
  • Provide leadership and develop appropriate recommendations for the implementation of related technology applications in support of enhanced services offered through Registration and Records
  • Problem solve the research, analysis and resolution of student disputes as they relate to records and registration
  • Collaborate with administrators, faculty leaders, faculty and IT to facilitate and improve services to students, including catalog and registration/records policy questions.
  • Apply academic policies and follow procedures necessary for compliance with federal, state and regulatory organizations.
  • Manage course changes including room changes, special event scheduling, or cancellations in the student information system and the learning management system.
  • Produce transcript processing for special requests or for records that are outside of the student information system
  • Produce any non-electronic records as requested by FERPA or other official request
  • Provide enrollment verifications to external agencies as requested
  • Manage course registration for off-sequence students, LOA returns, and reenters/reenrolls
  • Manage the attendance posting process – manual adjustments and tracking down unposted attendance
  • Manage grade changes and grade processing
  • Confirm course schedule with academic leadership
  • Initiate status changes for the following areas: Campus Withdrawals, Return from LOA, and Reenters, Cancels, SAP Dismissals
  • Initiate Program Transfer paperwork and scan appropriately
  • Perform address changes and enter additional demographic changes in CVue
  • Provide excellent customer service
  • Other duties as required or assigned.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a registrar’s office, services, educational administration or a related area.
  • Proven record of successful supervisory experience in a people-oriented environment
  • Demonstrated understanding of the application of technology to deliver Records and Registration services.
  • A proven record in working successfully with diverse populations
  • A positive attitude and ability to plan and adapt to change
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with college departments and cross-functional
  • Prior experience with managing a distance learning population

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

  • Communication Skills
  • Detail Oriented
  • Time-Management Skills
  • Organizational Skills
  • Team-oriented
  • Coachability: Being receptive to feedback, willing to learn, embracing continuous improvement
  • Ethics: Has personal and professional ethics and fosters a diverse and respectful workplace.
  • Ability to interact with staff and external relationships in a professional manner, including a demonstrated commitment to customer service.
  • Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office Products (Word, Excel, etc.)

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Nature of work requires an ability to operate standard business equipment. Siting for a long period of time; up to 8 hours of computer and/or phone work daily.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Majority of work is performed in a general office environment.

OTHER DUTIES

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities,

duties or responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Please note that this position can work remote from anywhere in the US or from the office in Schaumburg, IL

Apply for job

items.title: Technical Project Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content: Hello you. Biteable here. We're looking for a Technical Project Manager to help our product teams achieve big results in a wonderfully coordinated fashion. If you like working in a busy, quirky environment where the well-being of the team comes first, this might the thing for you. **A little about the Biteable culture**At Biteable we're committed to the happiness of our staff. We love it when everyone feels supported and we doubly love it when everyone feels empowered to create. The Biteable team is scattered around the globe from San Francisco to Hobart, and lots of places in between. Our diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are the glue that binds us. We treat each other like adults and we set our own schedules. We also recognize that families are part of our daily lives and we like that they often turn up on our video calls. **All about you*** **You really dig web tech.** You've been in the web technology sector for a while and you like it. Stuff that runs in a browser is what floats your boat.* **You're good at big projects.** You love running medium to large software development projects. And you've got plenty of experience doing it.* **You're agile.** Like a tiger, but then in an office and with fingers instead of claws. To be exact, you've got direct experience using Agile methodologies for managing projects and coaching teams.* **You know your stuff.** You're an expert at project management, bug tracking, and reporting tools.* **You're driven.** You've got superior organizational skills and you're great at following through on tasks. Your integrity shines like a sunbeam.* **You're most of the above.** But not necessarily all of them. You like to learn and you pick up new things quickly.**All about the role** * **You’ll manage your own schedule.** While you’ll need to maintain regular work hours (for the benefit of your team), you’re free to lay your day out the way you like it.* **You'll spin many plates.** Like an artist, you'll drive multiple projects simultaneously, all the way from start to finish.* **You'll manage four product teams.** Your daily activities will include scoping, resourcing, and tracking progress across all four teams.* **You'll facilitate communication.** In particular, you'll take care of sprint planning, standups, sprint reviews, retrospectives, and release planning.* **You'll make things transparent.** You'll provide cross-functional visibility into status, resourcing needs, dependencies, granular requirements, dates and escalations for projects.* **You'll work collaboratively** with Product & Engineering. And you'll communicate updates to all other functions.* **You'll have one eye on the customer.** In everything you do, you'll be focused on delivering value to Biteable customers.**All about us** We are Biteable, a tech start-up that makes (jaw-dropping) videos possible for everyone. We stand apart in our market thanks to our dedication to studio-quality content and our passion for simplicity. Since our launch in 2014 we’ve: * Created a community of over 6 million users* Rendered more than 10 million videos* Raised $3.9 million in venture capitalWe’re growing fast and have offices in Melbourne and Hobart, Australia, with remote team members scattered around the world. We are informal, structurally flat, and fun to work with. **A little more about our culture**Biteable is a bit of rarity. Everyone genuinely cares about each other. When asked, they use words like these to describe their colleagues: rigorous, respectful, open, supportive, honest, and egoless. Don't just take our word for it, though. Here are a few quotes that we didn't make up: _“I’m thankful for the flexibility Biteable gives me around my family commitments. I really like that my team is open to new ideas and processes. And I enjoy that I get to work on a variety of problems with a mix of people with diverse areas of expertise.”__“The development team is a great group of people. They’re smart and interested in doing high-quality work, but foster a social and supportive atmosphere, too.”__“Biteable's team of smart, funny, engaged, and caring people makes my work here enjoyable, every day. Being close to decisions and decision-makers helps me make an impact on our work.”__“At Biteable, you’re given the support and flexibility you need to do your best work in a way that suits your lifestyle. I’m continuously impressed by this team’s skill and unwavering passion. But what’s more, is that everyone operates with kindness, respect, and a great sense of humor.”_**How to apply**We want you to start soon. To apply, dispatch your CV and a short cover letter about why you and Biteable fit together like a kanban board and a calendar to jobs.2904201@biteable.com We’ll review your application and then set up informal interviews with a handful of candidates. We've got our fingers crossed that you're one of them — we're rooting for you.

items.title: Director of Product and Project Management
items.content:
Remote

We are looking for someone who can help manage the entire software cycle: planning, prioritizing, ticketing, reviewing, and managing the execution. You will work with the different software department leads to help prioritize and keep products moving through the pipeline. You will work with our QA and product teams to make sure all software is delivered on time, and high quality. You will help all of our teammates keep their personal ticket queues tidy.

Who you are:

  • You have been doing software / project management for 3+ years at a consumer internet company
  • You can work with others to prioritize and manage projects and products on their plate
  • You are borderline OCD about keeping documentation, project flows, and ticket lists curated and organized
  • You love the details. You love lists and charts. And you love getting things done.

What you will do:

  • You will work with 5 team leads and 4 other QA/Project Managers to keep on top of projects, initiatives, bugs, errors, and user suggestions
  • You will live inside of Jira
  • You will work with the product, design and marketing teams on strategy and priorities
  • You will coordinate and share the goals (OKRs) of each department in fully-transparent documentation
  • You will enjoy working with some of the brightest, kindest, smartest, and most passionate people on the planet

This is a full-time, 100% remote role open only to those in the USA/Canada. You can learn more about our team here:

  • https://www.chess.com/about
  • https://www.chess.com/blog/erik/how-chess-com-s-100-person-virtual-team-works-together
  • https://www.chess.com/jobs

Location: USA/Canada

Apply for job

items.title: Project Analyst
items.content:
Remote

Location: Remote

Description

LTS is seeking a Project Analyst to support the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Health Portfolio. The Project Analyst will be responsible with supporting the PMO Project Managers and VA Project Managers, working on data collection and coordination. The Project Analyst will also be responsible for recording action items and notes from VA meetings and interact with projects teams for distribution. This role must be able to conduct special projects requiring a high degree of confidentiality and independence. The environment is dynamic, demanding and the client needs are often evolving; flexibility and forward-thinking views are important for success. The Project Analyst will be developing, gathering and disseminating technical information and documentation among both business and technical customers.

The Health PMO support contract provides IT program management, project management, technical management, financial management, functional planning, and documentation analysis in support of the Enterprise Program Management Office (EPMO) Enterprise Program Management Division (EPMD) Health Portfolio

The VA Health Portfolio is focused on development and execution of quality IT projects that address the needs of Veterans and health care providers through management of health care information and sustainment of production software to keep the mission going.

Information about LTS

LTS is an acknowledged and award-winning multi-ISO/CMMI Level 3 appraised business focused on delivering first-class solutions to solve our clients’ business and technical challenges in providing quality healthcare and security to our nation.

LTS provides trusted consulting, and solutions in an increasingly complex and growing world. Our deep expertise in technology and analytics helps us serve a broad constituency of clients that range from cabinet-level departments of the U.S. Government to the largest Federal IT contractors in the world.

LTS is a leading information technology (IT) provider for mission-critical systems leveraging the latest technologies to deliver cutting edge solutions from small mobile applications to large, complex enterprise applications. Our professionals specialize in multiple disciplines including program management, system integration, system design, system development, cybersecurity, infrastructure and data analytics.

LTS is committed to offering eligible employee’s comprehensive benefits that will provide them with options intended to meet their needs and the needs of their family.

Qualifications and Responsibilities:

  • Communicate well with other leaders, teams and stakeholders
  • Strong facilitation skills
  • Researches and develops documentation about products and processes based on meetings with managers and subject matter experts.
  • Maintain a highly complex professional/administrative workload.
  • Responsible for on-time completion of all tasks assigned
  • Must have experience with the analysis of business, both functional and technical activities.
  • Responsible for working with users and customers to document and strategize for process improvements for current business processes (business process re-engineering).
  • Ability to gather, validate, and evaluate project, product and program data to develop ad hoc and recurring reports in short suspense.
  • Have strong analytical and investigation skills crafting solutions to challenging problems or issues
  • Must be able to organize and collect reporting among the projects on the program
  • Experience with VA development and release processes is highly desired
  • Understanding and supporting the Agile delivery model, whether Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), Lean Kanban or other iterative development approaches
  • Understanding of Devops and Tools
  • Ability to quickly learn and apply knowledge
  • Able to perform document reviews at an expert level.

Requirements:

  • Education Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Systems, Business or related scientific /technical discipline
  • 5 Years of Experienced Required (8 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education)
  • Familiar with the project management methodology is a plus
  • PM-related certifications such as CSM, PMP and ITIL are not required, but good to have
  • Ability to work independently with minimal guidance and supervision
  • Experience in all areas of the software development life cycle, enterprise-wide network engineering, strategic information planning, business process reengineering, structure and management practices a plus
  • Must have experience with diverse IT Development projects large enterprise environments.
  • Knowledge of Broadcom Rally Software is a plus

Security Clearance Requirements:

  • Ability to obtain and maintain a Department of Veterans Affairs Public Trust
Apply for job

The Center for Enlightened Business is focused on making the world a better place through helping small business owners grow and evolve. We focus on serving and empowering accountants to use their financial and business knowledge to help guide and advise the small business community all over North America to have more success, make more money, and make the world a better place through the fulfillment of their dreams. We empower our clients through a combination of our decades of experience in helping accountants grow their firms in more meaningful ways and with our focus on the human element of business, teaching them to recognize the limitations in their thinking that prevent breakthrough results. In the process of empowering them, their firms grow, they earn more money, work fewer hours, do more meaningful and impactful work, enjoy their lives more, and even feel more peace in their lives

We care about each person we work with. Each life we change has a positive ripple effect as they end up changing the lives of their teams, their clients, their families, and their communities as a result of this work. We deliver our results through coaching and offer 2 very powerful programs that help us make the world a better place through the context of having a more Enlightened business conversation.

#a

items.title: Shogun: Technical Project Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
Technical Project Manager

We Are…

Shogun, and we're on a mission to help people create the best eCommerce experiences in the world.

We were in the Winter 2018 batch of Y-Combinator, we just raised a Series A investment, we have over 10,000 active paying clients, and we're preparing to launch a new product in 2020 (you can read more in Tech Crunch).

Our teams are fully distributed and global (check out our team page)! We have no office, so we are looking for team members that are comfortable with and motivated by the opportunity to work remotely.


Location

We are a truly global team and its important for the person in this role to have overlap with both squads in order to be effective and successful. On the west we have people from GMT-5 to GMT. On the east have people from GMT+2 to GMT+8.



About You..
  • You get things done.
  • You are comfortable with ambiguity.
  • You know best practices of different agile methodologies, but you are not set on one, you can apply the best practices in a startup, async environment.
  • You work async. You use meetings strategically.
  • You understand tech, are familiar with the latest web technologies, and you have previous coding experience.
  • You understand startups are chaotic and you kind of like it. You are able to navigate, reign in and thrive in the chaos.

In this role you will...
  • Help the squads deliver in a fast-paced environment where there is not a lot of process and documentation to guide you.
  • Work with two squads in different timezones.
  • Get the needs from product/support/design/growth/engineering and break down the work into user stories and tasks that are clear for the engineering team to deliver.
  • Validate the specs and fulfill the missing parts. Sometimes, you will write the specs by yourself.
  • Organize backlogs, milestones, epics, and iterations.
  • Host the iteration ceremonies (the less, the better).
  • Communicate and create visibility for the entire company on what the squads are shipping.

You Have
  • 2+ years of working experience as a technical project manager in a startup or similar environment.
  • Working knowledge or proven understanding of software development lifecycle.
  • Background in engineering, quality assurance or design.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Our Stack
  • Clubhouse for managing stories
  • Slack for communication
  • Notion for documentation
  • Geekbot for daily updates
  • See more on stackshare

We Offer
  • Competitive salary
  • Benefits (vary by location)
  • A highly skilled and dedicated team that is fun to work with.
  • Remote work – We are a fully distributed team
  • Occasionally, we hire on a full time contractor basis to begin with. Team members enjoy the same opportunities for great compensation, full time positions, equity, and consideration, regardless of location.

Our Values
  • Work in the open: Operate with high integrity and choose what's right over what's easy. Be transparent as a company and with each other.
  • People are People: Treat yourself, colleagues, and customers with dignity, empathy, and respect. Start from a presumption of positive intent.
  • Win and grow together: Strive to be the best, individually and as a team. Support and encourage each other. Seek opportunities for growth.

Shogun supports workplace diversity and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity/expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class

items.title: Biteable: Technical Project Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Technical Project Manager


Hello you. Biteable here. We're looking for a Technical Project Manager to help our product teams achieve big results in a wonderfully coordinated fashion. If you like working in a busy, quirky environment where the well-being of the team comes first, this might the thing for you. 



A little about the Biteable culture 

At Biteable we're committed to the happiness of our staff. We love it when everyone feels supported and we doubly love it when everyone feels empowered to create. 


The Biteable team is scattered around the globe from San Francisco to Hobart, and lots of places in between. Our diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are the glue that binds us. 

We treat each other like adults and we set our own schedules. We also recognize that families are part of our daily lives and we like that they often turn up on our video calls. 



All about you 


  • You really dig web tech. You've been in the web technology sector for a while and you like it. Stuff that runs in a browser is what floats your boat.
  • You're good at big projects. You love running medium to large software development projects. And you've got plenty of experience doing it.
  • You're agile. Like a tiger, but then in an office and with fingers instead of claws. To be exact, you've got direct experience using Agile methodologies for managing projects and coaching teams.
  • You know your stuff. You're an expert at project management, bug tracking, and reporting tools.
  • You're driven. You've got superior organizational skills and you're great at following through on tasks. Your integrity shines like a sunbeam.
  • You're most of the above. But not necessarily all of them. You like to learn and you pick up new things quickly.


All about the role 


  • You’ll manage your own schedule. While you’ll need to maintain regular work hours (for the benefit of your team), you’re free to lay your day out the way you like it.
  • You'll spin many plates. Like an artist, you'll drive multiple projects simultaneously, all the way from start to finish.
  • You'll manage four product teams. Your daily activities will include scoping, resourcing, and tracking progress across all four teams.
  • You'll facilitate communication. In particular, you'll take care of sprint planning, standups, sprint reviews, retrospectives, and release planning.
  • You'll make things transparent. You'll provide cross-functional visibility into status, resourcing needs, dependencies, granular requirements, dates and escalations for projects.
  • You'll work collaboratively with Product & Engineering. And you'll communicate updates to all other functions.
  • You'll have one eye on the customer. In everything you do, you'll be focused on delivering value to Biteable customers.

All about us 

We are Biteable, a tech start-up that makes (jaw-dropping) videos possible for everyone. We stand apart in our market thanks to our dedication to studio-quality content and our passion for simplicity. 


Since our launch in 2014 we’ve: 
  • Created a community of over 6 million users
  • Rendered more than 10 million videos
  • Raised $3.9 million in venture capital
We’re growing fast and have offices in Melbourne and Hobart, Australia, with remote team members scattered around the world. We are informal, structurally flat, and fun to work with. 


A little more about our culture 


Biteable is a bit of rarity. Everyone genuinely cares about each other. When asked, they use words like these to describe their colleagues: rigorous, respectful, open, supportive, honest, and egoless. 

Don't just take our word for it, though. Here are a few quotes that we didn't make up: 

“I’m thankful for the flexibility Biteable gives me around my family commitments. I really like that my team is open to new ideas and processes. And I enjoy that I get to work on a variety of problems with a mix of people with diverse areas of expertise.” 

“The development team is a great group of people. They’re smart and interested in doing high-quality work, but foster a social and supportive atmosphere, too.” 

“Biteable's team of smart, funny, engaged, and caring people makes my work here enjoyable, every day. Being close to decisions and decision-makers helps me make an impact on our work.” 

“At Biteable, you’re given the support and flexibility you need to do your best work in a way that suits your lifestyle. I’m continuously impressed by this team’s skill and unwavering passion. But what’s more, is that everyone operates with kindness, respect, and a great sense of humor.” 




How to apply 

We want you to start soon. To apply, dispatch your CV and a short cover letter about why you and Biteable fit together like a kanban board and a calendar. 

We’ll review your application and then set up informal interviews with a handful of candidates. We've got our fingers crossed that you're one of them — we're rooting for you.

items.title: Head of Logistics
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Remote | International

People-first company, design-first home.

We are a design-first, home furnishing company focusing on the habits of urban dwellers and first time home buyers. We pride ourselves on the best in class customer happiness, providing the highest possible quality products that are affordable for the majority and assembly that isn’t dreadful.

As a people-first company, we understood from day one the importance of being fully distributed. We encourage everyone to work in a whichever manner that helps them perform their best.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

You’ll be responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of transportation, warehousing, and order fulfillment for Nathan James. You’ll help the operations team by managing relationships with all logistics 3rd parties, assisting with high level planning, continual improvement implementation, and creative cost reduction ideation/execution. As the driver of the Logistics Division, you will also have ample opportunity to carve out your own passion projects related to operational improvements and cost reductions.

A deep understanding of operations management, particularly focused on inbound and outbound modeling, is a pre-requisite for succeeding in this role.  Managing both an internal team and external partners also requires being able to provide support from multiple perspectives regarding any aspect related to operational processes.  Since this division and these processes are susceptible to continual change, the ideal candidate has the unique ability to quickly learn and teach these procedures.

During training, you’ll be expected to be proactive in your process and learn quickly. Once fully up-to-speed (2-3 months), you’ll have a complete understanding and ownership of day-to-day operations, provide managerial guidance to members of the Logistics Division, have the ability to monitor and report on Logistics KPIs, as well as, be able to verify and approve all invoices related to the Logistics Division.

ABOUT US:

We have a rhythm to our work and a very low turnover rate — we have yet to have a single team member opt-out. Your voice matters to us. We make change from fresh perspectives and appreciate new viewpoints, so you should feel comfortable speaking up about your values and goals.

We’re ready for the ongoing work that goes into building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best work of your career. Our values, workplace and our benefits are designed to support a sustainable, healthy relationship with your work. Our operating values provide the framework we use in building a healthy, resilient organization. https://nathanjames.com/blogs/latest/nathan-james-operating-values

You can expect a mindful onboarding process with ramp-up and time to learn. You can expect a team that listens, and to be heard. You can expect to give and provide direct feedback. You can expect to work with good people. You can expect to be counted on. You can expect to do your best work and build a career here.

ABOUT YOU:

We’re looking for someone with the ability to work in an agile environment by being proactive, flexible, efficient and task-focused. This means being a great problem-solver and having the technical strengths to find solutions and correct unforeseen issues extremely quickly. You should be able to constantly juggle daily decisions that directly impact the divisional KPIs, planning of logistics activity and growing volumes for 6-12 months out, as well as re-enforcing/implementing procedures to standardize divisional activity. You have a strong team mentality and ability to not only do what is asked, but to do what you believe is needed.

You can attribute most of what you love about the projects and tasks you work on to having an element of problem solving.  You have a pragmatic mind that enables you to be decisive, but you understand the theoretical practices of optimizing supply chains and how important it is to continue to implement where feasible.  Logistics has always been an area of interest to you because you enjoy the challenges involved with continually fine-tuning processes and you welcome new challenges that seem to occur in a field with so many moving parts.  It excites you to be a leader in the operational backbone of a company continuing to reach new heights every year.

We would like to see at a minimum of three years’ experience in designing operational systems, managing 3PL/warehouses, handling order fulfillment, and managing others in the logistics field. Advanced ability in excel, database management, project management, time management and the ability to manage people is essential to success in this role. The ideal candidate would also have a degree in a quantitative discipline with extensive education and/or experience within the logistics field of a primarily e-commerce company. 

For this role, please note that our current 3PL operates between 7am-4pm PST.  While it will not be required for you to work during these hours, there will be days where orders will need to be monitored and troubleshot throughout operating hours to ensure on-time delivery.

This is a remote role, since we are a remote/fully distributed company! You’re free to work where you work best, anywhere in the world: home office, coworking space, or coffee shops. You should be comfortable working remotely, that hinges on effective writing, self-discipline, and comfort with open communication.

BENEFITS & PERKS:

Our benefits are all aimed at supporting a life well lived, both at work and away from work.

We’re all about reasonable working hours, sharing, ample vacation time, wellness, education, comfort, and giving back. See our benefits and perks here

https://nathanjames.com/blogs/latest/benefits-perks-nathan-james 

HOW TO APPLY:

Please submit an application here that speaks directly to this position. https://airtable.com/shrBjNPaIdJAeCiX6

There are no right answers or cookie-cutter expectations. A cover letter is not required, but those that clearly demonstrate how Nathan James would be a great fit for you and how you would be a great fit for us will be given full attention and are highly appreciated.

We’re accepting applications until 05/12/2020 00:00:00 UTC.

Next: We expect to take a few days to review all applications.

You’ll hear from us by 5/21/2020 about advancement to an introductory call. If we both find the fit to right, then we would proceed to a work sample, then on to a interview. Our interviews are one hour to 1.5 hours all remote by Whereby video chat (no software needed), with your future colleagues, on your schedule.

We aim to make an offer by 7/3/2020 at the latest with a start date in mid July.

We appreciate your consideration in having Nathan James be part of your career. Our open conversation starts with this post. We look forward to hearing from you.

Apply for job

items.title: Social Work Field Education Director and Core Faculty
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote
  • Faculty
  • SOCIA01018
  • Full-Time
  • Remote-United States

Description

The Bachelor of Science major in Social Work at Union Institute & University (UI&U) invites applications for the Field Education Director and Core Faculty position.

This position is a remote, year-round, full-time appointment (with benefits).

Union’s Bachelor of Science major in Social Work is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE). Our social work program’s mission is to empower adult learners to apply professional knowledge, skills, ethics, and values for generalist social work with an emphasis on social justice and social change.

Our social work program goals are to prepare students to emulate the social work profession identity, ethically-grounded with cultural competence standards, demonstrate knowledge of evidence-based practice, and prepare students for leadership and graduate education.

Students choose social work at UI&U because of our small, personal learning community, and the flexibility our program offers to support diverse, non-traditional, and working students while maintaining responsibilities to their families and careers.

PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Administrative Responsibilities (40%-45%) include the following:

  • Act as an ambassador to the Social Work Program and UI&U.
  • Compose a field advisory committee of community stakeholders.
  • Maintain a student/agency placement database, field manual, field course syllabi, field forms, field assessment tools, pre-field placement process, field education policies, and procedures.
  • Assists in the decision-making regarding the Field Education calendar, submission time frames and deadlines of application forms for the field cycles-Fall, Winter, and Spring/Summer.
  • Function as a Field Liaison by consistent communication and visiting agencies, field supervisors, and students virtually; completes evaluations as required.
  • Assist the Program Director to ensure field education compliance in maintaining evaluation systems for CSWE accreditation and institutional effectiveness reporting.
  • Lead efforts to recruit, develop, and support field supervisors and field agency sites, including orientation, training, continuous working relationships, consultation, and assessment for effectiveness.
  • Provide ongoing training, support, and problem-solving for agency field supervisors, faculty, UI&U staff, and students.
  • Oversee field placement and performance of all eligible students in field agencies by assisting students in identifying field placements, including helping them obtain necessary clearances and completing appropriate paperwork.
  • Reviews Field Placement evaluations and assesses the strengths/concerns of agency sites and Field Supervisors in their assigned area.

Teaching responsibilities (35%-45%) include the following:

  • Advise Students
  • Teach social work courses.
  • Create and contribute to explicit and implicit curriculum and progress towards social work program accreditation.
  • Assist in the development of generalist courses to be integrated with field education.
  • Collaborate to lead and maintain the development of the field education curriculum.
  • Assist in developing policies relevant to online field education instruction and the completion of requirements.

Service and Scholarship (15%-20%) responsibilities include the following:

  • Provide faculty advising support for social work student organization(s).
  • Maintain a productive research agenda, scholarship, and professional development.
  • Serve on departmental, academic, and university committees/assignments.
  • Provide Field Education Information Sessions to educate social work students, field agencies/supervisors, other UI&U departments, and/or recruit prospective students.

Additional responsibilities include:

  • Hold regular virtual “office hours”.
  • Other duties as assigned by the Department Chair.
  • Assist with student recruitment and the admissions review process.
  • Must be able to construct student notes, reports, and related correspondence.

Required Qualifications:

  • MSW Degree from CSWE accredited program.
  • Minimum of two (2) years of professional practice with experiences in field practicum instruction, field administration, or field supervision experiences.
  • Minimum of two (2) years of experience teaching in a CSWE social work program.
  • Familiarity with CSWE accreditation.
  • Experience with web-based online instruction.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Ph.D. in Social Work or D.S.W. strongly preferred.
  • Licensed social worker.
  • Demonstrated academic and practice experience with case management and diverse populations (i.e., rural communities, GLBTQ+, gerontology).
  • Record of quality experience in social work education (i.e., administration, teaching, scholarship, and service).
  • Instructional design and course development experience.
  • Excellent organization, oral and written communication, and interpersonal skills to work effectively with faculty, university administration, professional community, and students.
  • Experience to incorporate social media, marketing promotion, and technology tools within field education and across the curriculum.

Qualifications

Education

Required

  • M.S.W. or better.

Preferred

  • D.S.W. or better.
  • Ph.D. or better in Social Work.

Experience

Required

  • 2 years: Minimum of 2 years of professional practice with experience in field practicum instruction, field administration, or field supervision experiences.
  • 2 years: Minimum of 2 years experience teaching in a CSWE social work program.
Apply for job

items.content:
Project Manager (software implementation)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Banking, Financial Technology, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 5k–10k people
Company type: Public
Company: Jack Henry & Associates, Inc.® – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time

Technologies

project-management
java
c#
.net
javascript

Job description

The Project Manager, manages the implementation, planning, execution, control and closing of installation/implementation projects.  This position at Jack Henry & Associates is a part of ProfitStars (Lending Solutions Group); who provides a software platform called Commercial Lending Center Suite that provides commercial credit analysis, underwriting, review and management solution, and many other commercial lending management tools. Lending Solutions Group is an operations team that assists the customer with set-up and configuration of the software, training, go-live support, and on-going software support.  The Project Manager is responsible for building the foundation of scope and scheduling of the projects. In addition, will handle planning and execution of client training, testing, and go-live activities.  You will be working in a Windows OS and SQL Database environment.

The position will mentor the client through defining requirements and configure the clients system to meet the defined commercial lending requirements. You will support the client through end-to-end testing for user acceptance purposes prior to the Production phase.  You will manage all project deliverables and project team/stakeholder communication from a scope, risk, and schedule standpoint.  The duration of projects can vary from short term to long term and size will vary based on the scope of the implementation and the client.  

This position can be based in one of the following locations: Birmingham, AL (downtown) or Remote.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must have a minimum of 5 years of experience in either of the following categories: conducting software implementations and or managing software implementation projects.
  • Must be able to travel up to 25% to conduct on-site software implementation and user training.  Travel is (Monday – Friday) and typically its 3 to 5 business days.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree.
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.
  • Commercial Lending industry experience.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 

  • Coordinates and monitors field support projects from initiation through delivery.  
  • Serves as liaison between the company and customer in order to ensure all implementation requirements and targets are met.
  • Serves as liaison between technical and non-technical departments in order to ensure all targets and requirements are met.
  • Ensures technical projects are completed on schedule.
  • Creates, updates and maintains all implementation calendars.
  • Monitors and tracks all escalated issues to resolution.
  • Assists in the implementation of project management tools and methodologies.
  • Assists in the creation of standard templates for project management deliverables.
  • Provides mentoring and support to other project managers in dealing with project management issues for assigned projects.
Apply

Benefits

  • Flexible Work Hours
  • Remote Work Opportunities
  • Competitive Salaries
  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
  • Awesome Health Insurance
  • Excellent PTO & Paid Holidays
  • Casual Business Attire
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Forbes Top 100 Best Places to Work 2017 (#2 in IT)
  • Computerworld's Best Places to Work in IT 2017

items.content:
Lead Application Developer / Technical Project Manager

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics, Developer APIs
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: MapLarge – Atlanta, GA

Remote details

Office Location: Atlanta, GA. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

c#
api
typescript
amazon-web-services
geolocation

Job description

100% Remote: This role allows working remotely 100% of the time from anywhere in the US.  Workers must be authorized to work in the US (No Non US Applicants Please). 

Who We Need: We are looking for experienced senior software developers to act as lead application developers helping to design and build applications for customers on top of the MapLarge product suite.  Applicants should have a strong history as a lead software developer (no non-technical project managers, please) and should be a top notch C# and JavaScript programmer. We are looking for sophisticated team members who are passionate about not only how UI is used, but also how the APIs, ontology, data structures, documentation, and examples come together to make both the UI components and technical APIs a pleasure for customers to use.

Typical Tasks: Typical Tasks include both writing code and leading planning activities.  You will often be acting as the lead technical point of contact on customer engagements, running internal and external planning meetings, helping to wireframe user interfaces, creating specs for the public facing APIs that drive them, doing deep dive code reviews with developers, and writing code for key portions of the deployed application.

Skills: While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, these are the key traits we prefer for this role:

  1. Smart & High Energy Engineer - We work at a very fast pace on cutting edge hard problems and we need people who can keep up.   We need people who really love producing results for customers and who enjoy programming and exhibit the energy and creativity that comes from being fully engaged in the technical side of what we do.
  2. Strong Software Development background - This job is definitely NOT for non technical project managers. Recent, hands-on experience coding both server side (C#) and client side (JavaScript) are strongly suggested, and 5+ years work experience as a professional programmer is required.  
  3. Experience Wireframing UI & Designing APIs - You do not have to have strong artistic skills, but you should be comfortable not only spec-ing out UI wireframes but also designing the supporting technical web service API’s and/or client side component API’s.
  4. Technical Project Management:  You should be highly organized with a strong history in either technical project management or as the lead developer for complex software development projects.  
  5. Customer Facing: comfortable meeting with sophisticated customers and managing expectations on large high value projects.
Easy apply

About MapLarge

MapLarge provides Big Data Analytics and Visualization to make the world safer, more productive, and more efficient.  The MapLarge API provides real time geospatial and predictive analytics for over 15 billion location events per day and trillions of historical events. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly query and visualize data on any desktop, mobile or tablet device.  All of our UI components are re-usable, data driven, event driven, API powered (client and server side), scriptable, re-configurable, savable, deep linkable, shareable etc.  We also have editor components, and data visualization wizards that allow non-technical users to import, automatically visualize data patterns (with sensible defaults that “just work”), conduct predictive analysis and also re-configure more advanced detailed settings with “what you see is what you get” editor tools.

Benefits

  • Flexible Hours
  • No Commute (work from home 100%)
  • Technically Excellent A+ Team solving very hard interesting problems
  • Friendly People - Postitive attitude is our #1 criteria
  • 401k
  • We like all kinds of people
  • Family Friendly
  • Top Notch Health Care
  • Cutting Edge Tech

items.title: Director of Technical Product Management at EverQuote (Cambridge, MA)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Director of Technical Product Management

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Designer, Product Manager
Industry: Ad Tech, Insurance, internet software
Company size: 201–500 people
Company type: Public
Company: EverQuote – Cambridge, MA

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Cambridge, MA. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

project-management
product-management
user-experience
data-driven
sdlc

Job description

This is only for US applicants.

We are looking for a Product Leader who enjoys working on challenging, high impact, greenfield problems. As Director of Product Management, you are responsible for understanding customer needs, agent needs, market trends, and defining product roadmaps that use technology effectively to dramatically improve customer and agent experience. The services and operations we own will be responsible for millions of dollars in revenue, resulting in us having a huge opportunity to move the needle in a positive direction. The team has a strong group of senior engineering and business talent, so it will be a great place for someone to deliver results.

This role will own Product for our On-Demand Agency (ODA), and initially it will be individual contributor with opportunity to lead a group of Product Managers after 18 months that drive growth and own strategy for ODA. As part of the leadership team, you will envision, design, deliver, plan and drive both customer facing and agent facing innovations to enable critical business operations. Specifically, you will report directly to the EVP of ODA and partner with other functional leaders in Engineering, UX design, Operations, Sales, Marketing, Distribution, Traffic Acquisition, Legal, and Finance, to translate the business requirements into world class technical specifications. You will have end to end ownership - all the way from defining the strategy to measuring metrics to monitoring day to day progress of these programs. You will provide direct visibility to senior leadership on all aspects of your programs on a regular cadence.

You must be comfortable dealing with tremendous ambiguity, be strongly technical, be an analytical & critical thinker, and possess excellent problem-solving and communication skills. You will be a strong leader that can provide functional, tactical and responsive leadership to your team. Your oral and written communication skills will be top notch and you will excel in stakeholder relationship management. You will be passionate about your work, see the strategic big-picture yet be detail-oriented and be organized. You will have proven leadership skills in a very fast-paced highly demanding environment. You will have a strong software development background, and in managing and delivering large cross-functional products and programs. You will be calm and composed in times of crisis and be able to respond to escalations with data and causal analysis.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Lead the development of the consumer-focused software product strategy and vision supported by internal and external analysis
  • Define creative, high quality, simple product roadmaps based on team strategy and vision
  • Develop detailed, crisp business requirements, epics and user stories in JIRA that can be used to create product specifications and architecture
  • Create wireframes, workflows and business rules using diagramming tools to document and communicate requirements in most crisp manner
  • Evaluate product development scope by understanding the consumer’s needs
  • Manage prioritization and trade-offs among customer experience, performance and operational support load
  • Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners
  • Work closely with engineering teams and program management to deliver software products to market
  • Drive product launches including working with business development team, executives, and other product management team members
  • Proactively identify and resolve strategic issues that may impair the team’s ability to meet strategic, financial, and technical goals

 About You:

  • 7-15+ years of professional experience of software product management experience, including 2+ years leading a team of Product Managers, and 3+ years of software development experience. These experiences could have occurred concurrently. A history of product management in a startup environment. History of teamwork and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done.
  • BS/BA in a technology, engineering or related field and an MBA (or advanced quantitative/technical degree preferred).
  • Broad technical breadth including familiarity with web front end, web services and back-end application and services infrastructure. A deep understanding of software development in a team, and a proven track record of shipping software quickly, experimenting, A/B testing and iterating on the experience.
  • Experienced in drawing diagrams, flow charts and wireframes to effectively communicate with distributed designers, engineers and operations.
  • Experienced in successfully and succinctly communicating with end users about upcoming features, new features, and support issues in written and diverse visual forms. You must have obsession for end users and have had experience delighting end users and gathering qualitative and quantitative feedback.
  • Demonstrated analytical, critical and quantitative skills, the ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases. Demonstrated ability to dive deep in understanding the product, our business, and the competitive landscape
  • Experienced in leading cross-functional teams to deliver multiple, concurrent software projects on tight deadlines. Experience coordinating complex product development cycles, cross team dependencies, realistic planning and scheduling, accounting for various phases of software development life cycle. You ensure that smart trade-offs are made in order for projects to be completed in an appropriate and timely manner, acknowledging mistakes, learning from them and always moving forward productively.
  • Experienced in specifying edge cases and dependencies so that they are discovered at planning stage rather than at delivery stage.
  • Utilized a combination of metrics, research and intuition to evaluate opportunities, establish roadmaps and build solutions.
  • Excellent written communication is extremely critical in this role. Demonstrated competence in written communication to effectively and efficiently articulate both strategic vision and specific technical details to various stakeholders, from senior leadership to individual contributors. 
  • Ability to think strategically and execute methodically. High attention to detail including precise and effective customer communications and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
  • Proven track record of taking ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Easy apply

About EverQuote

As we prepare for rapid business growth from here, EverQuote, a leader in insurance tech and largest online insurance market place is seeking to hire experienced technical Product Managers who have experience building, releasing and maintained at least 3-4 production grade software products.  We are seeking engineers who are agile, who have opinion for great software components and services with great attention to detail in delivering reliable software that is well tested according to user expectations.

Benefits

  • 401k
  • Health
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • Equity (for US employees only)

items.title: Technical Project Management Immersion Instructor at Thinkful Inc.
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=9, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Technical Project Management Immersion Instructor

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Online Education, Web Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Thinkful Inc. – No office location

Technologies

project-management
sql
lifecycle

Job description

Technical Project Management Immersion Instructor

Apply Here

  • Education
  • Remote

Description Students enroll in Thinkful courses to gain valuable technical and professional skills needed to take them from curious learners to employed technical project managers. As an Immersive Course Instructor, you will deliver high-quality live workshop content based on existing curriculum, provide support to students in completing their daily tasks as well as capstone projects, and prepare students to successfully transition careers. 
In addition to working directly with students, Instructors are expected to maintain an environment of regular, candid feedback with the Educator Experience team, and to stay on top of important updates via meetings, emails, and Slack. Ideal candidates for this team are highly coachable, display genuine student advocacy, and are comfortable working in a complex, fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.  Responsibilities:


  • Delivers high-quality workshops based on the curriculum materials, and provides live demos and examples when appropriate, supplements written materials and content to provide students with the skills and knowledge to get their first technical project manager job. 
  • Maintains and updates the daily and weekly student syllabus, which outlines the required homework and assignments, and deadlines for assessments and projects 
  • Maintains and updates the daily student performance and attendance documents, reports student status to the right teams and follows up on a timely manner to ensure students’ success
  • Provides daily on-demand video and chat support for students as they move through the program 
  • Spends up to 4 hours a day prepping for workshops and updating course materials as needed
  • Works with the operational leads for engagement formats (Mentor Sessions, Group Sessions, Grading, Technical Coaching, Mock Interviews/Assessments) to ensure that consistent experience is happening for students in immersive courses 
  • Works with the Academic Success Management (ASM) team to ensure student success in a timely manner 
  • Provide constructive feedback to the Instructional Design team on improvements to the course materials and curriculum based on student experience with the materials 

Requirements:

  • Must have 6+ years of professional experience as a project manager, and 4+ years as a technical or IT project manager for a mid- to large-size company. This experience can be concurrent.
  • Strong expertise with project life cycles, systems development life cycles, business process related to project management, emotional intelligence, communication, stakeholder management, conflict management, leadership, the software and tools used by project managers (such as collaboration tools, scheduling tools, Enterprise Risk Management tools, and organizational process assets), programming and coding as it relates to a technical project manager (such as Git Workflow, HTML Basics, styling with CSS, Javascript, Python, SQL, PHP, and C++—it’s important to note that they do not have to be fluent in these languages, but have to have an empathetic knowledge of them that allows them to understand the what, when, where, how, and why of their use), and IT Management (including database management, cloud computing, governance risk & compliance, cybersecurity and incident response, and IT infrastructure and networking).
  • Teaching experience, especially in a remote or online class, and ability to supplement teaching with professional experience in the topics mentioned above
  • Ability to manage remote classroom without a lot of direct supervision
  • Ability to explain complicated topics clearly and without jargon
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience working in a remote environment and understanding how to collaborate and communicate in such an environment
  • Be comfortable and maintain composure working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
  • Ability to raise and solve problem in a timely manner 
  • Strong problem-solving skills 
  • High level of detail orientation and an exceptional work ethic
  • Enjoy working with people, not just putting your head down and working
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection with clear audio and video in a non-distracting workplace

Compensation and benefits

  • Competitive base salary and equity
  • Healthcare, dental, and vision insurance are 100% covered for individuals and meaningfully covered for families
  • 401k plan options
  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Expand your skills with free Thinkful courses and a Mentor, plus discounts for friends and family
  • Commuter Benefits Card via WageWorks
  • Paid Parental Leave


Thinkful can only hire candidates who are eligible to work in the United States. We stand against any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. Thinkful provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants. If you're talented and driven, please apply. At this time, we are unable to consider applicants from the following states: Alaska, Delaware, Idaho, New Mexico, North Dakota, South Carolina, South Dakota, West Virginia, and Wyoming

Apply

About Thinkful Inc.

Thinkful is a new type of school that brings high-growth tech careers to ambitious people everywhere. The company provides 1-on-1 learning through its network of industry experts, hiring partners, and online platform to deliver a structured and flexible education. Thinkful offers programs in web development and data science, with in-person communities in up-and-coming tech hubs around the U.S. To join the Thinkful network visit thinkful.com.

Benefits

  • Join team of 500+ developers mentoring the developers of the future
  • Access to top-rated curriculum
  • Paid position
  • Flexible Schedule and Hours
  • Remote Capability

items.title: Nathan James: Head of Logistics
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Head of Logistics

Nathan James is looking for a Head of Logistics to join our team in providing the best product availability and delivery service for our customers.



People-first company, design-first home.
We are a design-first, home furnishing company focusing on the habits of urban dwellers and first time home buyers. We pride ourselves on the best in class customer happiness, providing the highest possible quality products that are affordable for the majority and assembly that isn’t dreadful.


As a people-first company, we understood from day one the importance of being fully distributed. We encourage everyone to work in a whichever manner that helps them perform their best.



 


ABOUT THE ROLE:

You’ll be responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of transportation, warehousing, and order fulfillment for Nathan James. You’ll help the operations team by managing relationships with all logistics 3rd parties, assisting with high level planning, continual improvement implementation, and creative cost reduction ideation/execution. As the driver of the Logistics Division, you will also have ample opportunity to carve out your own passion projects related to operational improvements and cost reductions.


 


A deep understanding of operations management, particularly focused on inbound and outbound modeling, is a pre-requisite for succeeding in this role.  Managing both an internal team and external partners also requires being able to provide support from multiple perspectives regarding any aspect related to operational processes.  Since this division and these processes are susceptible to continual change, the ideal candidate has the unique ability to quickly learn and teach these procedures.


 


During training, you’ll be expected to be proactive in your process and learn quickly. Once fully up-to-speed (2-3 months), you’ll have a complete understanding and ownership of day-to-day operations, provide managerial guidance to members of the Logistics Division, have the ability to monitor and report on Logistics KPIs, as well as, be able to verify and approve all invoices related to the Logistics Division.




ABOUT YOU: 

We’re looking for someone with the ability to work in an agile environment by being proactive, flexible, efficient and task-focused. This means being a great problem-solver and having the technical strengths to find solutions and correct unforeseen issues extremely quickly. You should be able to constantly juggle daily decisions that directly impact the divisional KPIs, planning of logistics activity and growing volumes for 6-12 months out, as well as re-enforcing/implementing procedures to standardize divisional activity. You have a strong team mentality and ability to not only do what is asked, but to do what you believe is needed.


 


You can attribute most of what you love about the projects and tasks you work on to having an element of problem solving.  You have a pragmatic mind that enables you to be decisive, but you understand the theoretical practices of optimizing supply chains and how important it is to continue to implement where feasible.  Logistics has always been an area of interest to you because you enjoy the challenges involved with continually fine-tuning processes and you welcome new challenges that seem to occur in a field with so many moving parts.  It excites you to be a leader in the operational backbone of a company continuing to reach new heights every year.


 


We would like to see at a minimum of three years’ experience in designing operational systems, managing 3PL/warehouses, handling order fulfillment, and managing others in the logistics field. Advanced ability in excel, database management, project management, time management and the ability to manage people is essential to success in this role. The ideal candidate would also have a degree in a quantitative discipline with extensive education and/or experience within the logistics field of a primarily e-commerce company.


 


For this role, please note that our current 3PL operates between 7am-4pm PST.  While it will not be required for you to work during these hours, there will be days where orders will need to be monitored and troubleshot throughout operating hours to ensure on-time delivery.


This is a remote role, since we are a remote/fully distributed company! You’re free to work where you work best, anywhere in the world: home office, coworking space, or coffee shops. You should be comfortable working remotely, that hinges on effective writing, self-discipline, and comfort with open communication.


BENEFITS & PERKS:

Our benefits are all aimed at supporting a life well lived, both at work and away from work.


We’re all about reasonable working hours, sharing, ample vacation time, wellness, education, comfort, and giving back. See our benefits and perks here: https://nathanjames.com/blogs/latest/benefits-perks-nathan-james



HOW TO APPLY: 


Please submit an application here that speaks directly to this position: https://airtable.com/shrBjNPaIdJAeCiX6


There are no right answers or cookie-cutter expectations. A cover letter is not required, but those that clearly demonstrate how Nathan James would be a great fit for you and how you would be a great fit for us will be given full attention and are highly appreciated. 


We’re accepting applications until 05/12/2020 00:00:00 UTC. 


Next: We expect to take a few days to review all applications. 


You’ll hear from us by 5/21/2020 about advancement to an introductory call. If we both find the fit to right, then we would proceed to a work sample, then on to a interview. Our interviews are one hour to 1.5 hours all remote by Whereby video chat (no software needed), with your future colleagues, on your schedule.  


We aim to make an offer by 7/3/2020 at the latest with a start date in mid July.


We appreciate your consideration in having Nathan James be part of your career. Our open conversation starts with this post. We look forward to hearing from you.

items.title: Director of Engineering
